subject: Changed link lineinfile to template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-25 03:13:56.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/pip_lock_down/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/pip_lock_down/templates/link_file.j2'], 'message': 'Changed link lineinfile to template

This change ensures that all link files created are built from a template
rather than using the lineinfile module which will result in multiple entries
per file. While these multiple entries do not break deployments they do create
a slower install / upgrade time.

Change-Id: I4fef53baf075c953ac73500e72f9388f7ccfa2a0
Closes-Bug: #1468587
(cherry picked from commit a4179512bc8e3680a5c6e1fb702af18eb62ee841)
'}]
commit_message:
Changed link lineinfile to template

This change ensures that all link files created are built from a template
rather than using the lineinfile module which will result in multiple entries
per file. While these multiple entries do not break deployments they do create
a slower install / upgrade time.

Change-Id: I4fef53baf075c953ac73500e72f9388f7ccfa2a0
Closes-Bug: #1468587
(cherry picked from commit a4179512bc8e3680a5c6e1fb702af18eb62ee841)

'}]
commit_message:
remove unused event query

when querying events, the sql backend builds a query it never uses.
this patch removes unused query.

Change-Id: I4f6232ae6bad07a2c851b691837dcf90c0d2c196

subject: Ensure validations account for trailing newlines
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-03 14:55:37.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/test_schema/test_format.py', 'designate/schema/format.py'], 'message': 'Ensure validations account for trailing newlines

The regex's used for validation allowed "\n" terminated strings
to pass, allowing invalid data through.

Change-Id: Iae4c40ffab9951280bb6d67c2a7cb779dc7ddf0f
Closes-Bug: 1471158
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure validations account for trailing newlines

The regex's used for validation allowed "\n" terminated strings
to pass, allowing invalid data through.

Change-Id: Iae4c40ffab9951280bb6d67c2a7cb779dc7ddf0f
Closes-Bug: 1471158

commit_message:
Sort dynamic inventory files in Juno

By enabling sort_keys for the files rpc_hostnames_ips.yml and rpc_inventory.json,
both will now be sorted. Tabs replaced with spaces at the request of Matt Thompson.

Change-Id: I2e277491261dac6292fe8485a9ac03a3815debee
Closes-Bug: #1472038

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-07 19:41:35.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/api/controllers/v1/container.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_replicationcontroller.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/test_validation.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_service.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/replicationcontroller.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_container.py', 'magnum/api/validation.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/pod.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_pod.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/service.py'], 'message': 'Validate bay type on creating resources

Ensure k8s resource (i.e. Pod/Service/RC) to be created only on a
k8s bay, and docker swarm resource (i.e. Container) to be created
only on a swarm bay. Also, return a 400 error if the bay type is
not matched.

Change-Id: I88b747c590f13a2e0da2bd59f1b0cbcc389d9b14
Closes-Bug: 1470963
'}]
commit_message:
Validate bay type on creating resources

Ensure k8s resource (i.e. Pod/Service/RC) to be created only on a
k8s bay, and docker swarm resource (i.e. Container) to be created
only on a swarm bay. Also, return a 400 error if the bay type is
not matched.

Change-Id: I88b747c590f13a2e0da2bd59f1b0cbcc389d9b14
Closes-Bug: 1470963

commit_message:
Enable endpoint filter parameters for the CLI

Currently the barbican client library can take parameters necessary for
keystone to give a proper endpoint given certain options. these options
could be 'service type', 'service name', 'region name', 'interface' and
'version'. These options, however, were not available from the CLI. So
the user would be stuck with the default options; which are not really
useful if you're trying to access the barbican instance from another
region.

This CR enables such options for the CLI also.

Change-Id: I66f9ec4d1330297c11bad0336decef5465a80cc3

commit_message:
List federated projects from keystoneauth

Handle the EmptyCatalog exception raised from the
keystoneauth.keystoneauth1.service_catalog.url_for
function in the unscoped token case.

Also make sure AUTH_INTERFACE is passed in from
keystoneauth1.auth.base not keystoneclient.auth.base
so that it passes the check at
keystoneauth.keystoneauth1.auth.identity.base.get_endpoint

Co-Authored-By: Paulo Ewerton Gomes Fragoso <pauloewerton@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: Iae995dd6ea799c064cb926786471e9f9fa221635
Closes-Bug: #1471943

commit_message:
Allow vendor methods to serve static files

This patch adds a new parameter called 'attach' to the @passthru and
@driver_passthru decorators. If attach is True Ironic API will attach
the return value from the vendor method to the response object instead
of returning it in the response body (as it was before), this parameter
defaults to False.

Although this patch is a plumbing work for the blueprint
ipxe-dynamic-config it can be used separately from that. With this
extension any new vendor passthru method is able to serve static files
from the Ironic API.

Related-Blueprint: ipxe-dynamic-config
Change-Id: If2537efa35667aedd72581b4ed064992b00f9c18

commit_message:
Removed dependency on Spark plugin in edp code

The EDP Spark engine was importing a config helper from the Spark
plugin.
The helper was moved to common plugin utils and now is imported from
there by both the plugin and the engine.

This is the part of sahara and plugins split.

Partially-implements bp: move-plugins-to-separate-repo
Change-Id: Ie84cc163a09bf1e7b58fcdb08e0647a85492593b

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-25 18:23:23.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/packages.pp'], 'message': 'Add tripleo::packages

This adds a new class to help configure package installation
and upgrades.

The previous approach was to use a global package declaration
at the top of each manifest within the tripleo-heat-templates.

The new approach is to use a Package collector (<| |>) to
allow us to configure the package provider within a
class. This should help remove some of the duplicated logic
within the triplo-heat-template manifests and is
also a good fit for puppet-tripleo in that is generic
and unlikely to change that often.

In addition to installation this class also support upgrades
to puppet managed packages as well.

Change-Id: Ie8fbc344149bc8c9977e127de77636903607617a
'}]
commit_message:
Add tripleo::packages

This adds a new class to help configure package installation
and upgrades.

The previous approach was to use a global package declaration
at the top of each manifest within the tripleo-heat-templates.

The new approach is to use a Package collector (<| |>) to
allow us to configure the package provider within a
class. This should help remove some of the duplicated logic
within the triplo-heat-template manifests and is
also a good fit for puppet-tripleo in that is generic
and unlikely to change that often.

In addition to installation this class also support upgrades
to puppet managed packages as well.

Change-Id: Ie8fbc344149bc8c9977e127de77636903607617a

commit_message:
Switch to oslo.policy

Remove openstack.common.policy module.
In the most situations in the tests import the private oslo_policy._parser module
as policy_parser instead of openstack.common.policy as common_policy. Because
the policy module doesn't contain the parser_rule method, but we need It to run
in the unit tests. Use a 'oslo_policy' group for the related to the oslo_policy options.

Change-Id: I6e509843c082bba94efe8305730e3199c3705ee9

subject: Fixed problem with extracting information from glance object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 13:15:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/image/glance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/image/test_glance.py'], 'message': 'Fixed problem with extracting information from glance object

When we get information about image from glance, "disk_format"
and "container_format" properties stored directly in image object.
But when we getting information about snapshot grom glance,
this properties are stored in dict "properties" in image object.
So in this case we need to move them to the image object.

Closes-Bug: #1431951

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/image/test_glance.py

Change-Id: Id1e9996da577644a011082212f1d60227ffd923c
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed problem with extracting information from glance object

When we get information about image from glance, "disk_format"
and "container_format" properties stored directly in image object.
But when we getting information about snapshot grom glance,
this properties are stored in dict "properties" in image object.
So in this case we need to move them to the image object.

Closes-Bug: #1431951

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/image/test_glance.py

Change-Id: Id1e9996da577644a011082212f1d60227ffd923c

subject: Changed target version of NovaCompute object during Service backport
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 13:15:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/service.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_service.py'], 'message': 'Changed target version of NovaCompute object during Service backport

When backporting a Service object to Icehouse version the embedded
ComputeNode object was being sent back at the wrong version.
It happens because ComputeNode object is too new for Icehouse.
Icehouse ComputeNode object is 1.3 not 1.4.

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/objects/compute_node.py?h=stable/icehouse#n27

Closes-Bug: #1436819

Change-Id: Ie8ff8e01557dd8e13994af0b7fa46de04c0b7116

commit_message:
Changed target version of NovaCompute object during Service backport

When backporting a Service object to Icehouse version the embedded
ComputeNode object was being sent back at the wrong version.
It happens because ComputeNode object is too new for Icehouse.
Icehouse ComputeNode object is 1.3 not 1.4.

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/objects/compute_node.py?h=stable/icehouse#n27

Closes-Bug: #1436819

Change-Id: Ie8ff8e01557dd8e13994af0b7fa46de04c0b7116

commit_message:
Move common configs under common.configs

We've some options in bootstrap and other places that should probably go
to a common place so that we can guarantee they are always registered
when the Zaqar starts.

This patch adds a new zaqar.common.config module that holds all the
common configs but doesn't register them. This step is still performed
when it is required.

Change-Id: I9941095ed56835093d56b5ad2bf85b53bdda0c8b
Partially-Implements: pre-signed-url

liveness via FixedIntervalLoopingCall should never allow exceptions

Further improvement of FixedIntervalLoopingCall might be needed,
but for the sake of easy backporting it makes sense to fix the issue

commit_message:
Catch broad exception in methods used in FixedIntervalLoopingCall

Unlike other places where it might make sense to catch specific
exceptions, methods that are used to check L3 and DHCP agents
liveness via FixedIntervalLoopingCall should never allow exceptions
to leak to calling method and interrupt the loop.

Further improvement of FixedIntervalLoopingCall might be needed,
but for the sake of easy backporting it makes sense to fix the issue
in neutron before pushing refactoring to 3rd-party library.

Change-Id: I6a61e99a6f4e445e26ea4a9923b47e35559e5703
Closes-Bug: #1458119
(cherry picked from commit ae8c1c5f80fd4fb7b4ab116677f4cff988c67cf1)

commit_message:
rabbit: redeclare consumers when ack/requeue fail

In case the acknowledgement or requeue of a message fail,
the kombu transport can be disconnected

In this case, we must redeclare our consumers.

This changes fixes that.

This have no tests because the kombu memory transport we use in our tests
cannot be in disconnected state.

Closes-bug: #1448650

(cherry picked from commit 415db68b67368d7c8aa550e7108122200816e665)

Conflicts are due to the refactoring to oslo_messaging namespace.

Conflicts:
	oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py
	oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py

Change-Id: I5991a4cf827411bc27c857561d97461212a17f40

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-06 14:56:15.000000000', 'files': ['environments/cinder-netapp-config.yaml', 'extraconfig/controller/cinder-netapp.yaml', 'puppet/extraconfig/pre_deploy/default.yaml', 'extraconfig/post_deploy/README', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/extraconfig/pre_deploy/controller/cinder-netapp.yaml', 'puppet/extraconfig/pre_deploy/controller/multiple.yaml', 'extraconfig/controller/noop.yaml', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/extraconfig/pre_deploy/README'], 'message': 'Wire in Controller pre-deployment extraconfig

The recently added cinder-netapp extraconfig contains some additional
hieradata which needs to be applied during the initial pre-deployment
phase, e.g in controller-puppet.yaml (before the manifests are applied)
so wire in a new OS::TripleO::ControllerExtraConfigPre provider resource
which allows passing in a nested stack (empty by default) which contains
any required "pre deployment" extraconfig, such as applying this hieradata.

Some changes were required to the cinder-netapp extraconfig and environment
such that now the hieradata is actually applied, and the parameter_defaults
specified will be correctly mapped into the StructuredDeployment.

Change-Id: I8838a71db9447466cc84283b0b257bdb70353ffd
'}]
commit_message:
Wire in Controller pre-deployment extraconfig

The recently added cinder-netapp extraconfig contains some additional
hieradata which needs to be applied during the initial pre-deployment
phase, e.g in controller-puppet.yaml (before the manifests are applied)
so wire in a new OS::TripleO::ControllerExtraConfigPre provider resource
which allows passing in a nested stack (empty by default) which contains
any required "pre deployment" extraconfig, such as applying this hieradata.

Some changes were required to the cinder-netapp extraconfig and environment
such that now the hieradata is actually applied, and the parameter_defaults
specified will be correctly mapped into the StructuredDeployment.

Change-Id: I8838a71db9447466cc84283b0b257bdb70353ffd

commit_message:
Fix the download error when the image locations are blank

When the image locations are blank, glance client will get a http response with no content, glance client should
show user no data could be found, instead of processing the blank response body that will lead to exception.

Fixes Bug 1472449

Change-Id: Ic982dc16e73b93503e0d088c4339d3affbdf6efe

commit_message:
Migrate to oslo_db

Currently, Ironic-inspector uses SQLite as database.
We should migrate to oslo.db.
In this patch, make database connect operations to oslo_db.

Change-Id: Ibd0f787b570bc101eab9fbd0b59d8a775a95e2e0
Implements: blueprint migrate-to-oslodb

subject: Fix kilo repo installation for RedHat
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-22 20:39:54.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/repo/redhat/params.pp', 'manifests/repo/redhat/redhat.pp', 'files/RPM-GPG-KEY-RDO-Kilo', 'spec/classes/openstack_extras_repo_redhat_redhat_spec.rb'], 'message': "Fix kilo repo installation for RedHat

In kilo, the RDO repository changed the end of its URL path from
'epel-7' to 'el7' for RedHat and CentOS and from 'fedora-#' to 'f#'.
Judging by the liberty testing repository, this will continue to be the
pattern for future releases. This patch adds logic to use the correct
path for Kilo and future releases. It also updates the GPG key to use
the correct one from the RDO-release repository[1].

[1] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/rdo-release/blob/master/RPM-GPG-KEY-RDO-kilo

Change-Id: Ia309b78e81236dee95d2d741fece323929b35709
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kilo repo installation for RedHat

In kilo, the RDO repository changed the end of its URL path from
'epel-7' to 'el7' for RedHat and CentOS and from 'fedora-#' to 'f#'.
Judging by the liberty testing repository, this will continue to be the
pattern for future releases. This patch adds logic to use the correct
path for Kilo and future releases. It also updates the GPG key to use
the correct one from the RDO-release repository[1].

[1] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/rdo-release/blob/master/RPM-GPG-KEY-RDO-kilo

Change-Id: Ia309b78e81236dee95d2d741fece323929b35709

Assumes devstack was configured with SERVICE_IP_VERSION in
local.conf

SERVICE_IP_VERSION is stored in .stackenv and checked in
openrc. If SERVICE_IP_VERSION is set to 6, openrc will use
IPv6.

NOTE: At first, I added a '-6' option to the openrc call
which would set the HOSTS accordingly. I then simplified
the code by saving SERVICE_IP_VERSION to the .stackenv file
which is sourced by openrc. After that, I simplified the
code even more by removing an extra, unnecessary, variable.

Change-Id: I5d46d5438d3e56fea788720ca17f0010caef3df1
"}]
commit_message:
Add IPv6 support to openrc files

Assumes devstack was configured with SERVICE_IP_VERSION in
local.conf

SERVICE_IP_VERSION is stored in .stackenv and checked in
openrc. If SERVICE_IP_VERSION is set to 6, openrc will use
IPv6.

NOTE: At first, I added a '-6' option to the openrc call
which would set the HOSTS accordingly. I then simplified
the code by saving SERVICE_IP_VERSION to the .stackenv file
which is sourced by openrc. After that, I simplified the
code even more by removing an extra, unnecessary, variable.

Change-Id: I5d46d5438d3e56fea788720ca17f0010caef3df1

[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-07-02 21:16:53.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/mysql', 'lib/cinder', 'lib/nova', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'samples/local.conf', 'lib/neutron-legacy', 'README.md', 'lib/database', 'functions-common', 'lib/swift', 'lib/glance', 'stackrc', 'stack.sh'], 'message': 'Add IPv6 support to devstack infrastructure

By default, most Openstack services are bound to 0.0.0.0
and service endpoints are registered as IPv4 addresses.
With this change we introduce two new variables to control
this behavior:

SERVICE_IP_VERSION - can either be "4" or "6".

When set to "4" (default if not set) devstack will operate
as today - most services will open listen sockets on 0.0.0.0
and service endpoints will be registered using HOST_IP as the
address.

When set to "6" devstack services will open listen sockets on ::
and service endpoints will be registered using HOST_IPV6 as the
address.

There is no support for "4+6", more work is required for that.

HOST_IPV6 - if SERVICE_IP_VERSION=6 this must be an IPv6
address configured on the system.

Some existing services, like the Openvswitch agent, will continue
to use IPv4 addresses for things like tunnel endpoints.  This is
a current restriction in the code and can be updated at a later
time.  This change is just a first step to supporting IPv6-only
control and data planes in devstack.

This change is also partly based on two previous patches,
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140519/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176898/

Change-Id: I5c0b775490ce54ab104fd5e89b20fb700212ae74
Co-Authored-By: Sean Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>
Co-Authored-By: Baodong Li <baoli@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sridhar Gaddam <sridhar.gaddam@enovance.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Kacmarsky <adam.kacmarsky@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Alvis <jeremy.alvis@hp.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add IPv6 support to devstack infrastructure

By default, most Openstack services are bound to 0.0.0.0
and service endpoints are registered as IPv4 addresses.
With this change we introduce two new variables to control
this behavior:

SERVICE_IP_VERSION - can either be "4" or "6".

When set to "4" (default if not set) devstack will operate
as today - most services will open listen sockets on 0.0.0.0
and service endpoints will be registered using HOST_IP as the
address.

When set to "6" devstack services will open listen sockets on ::
and service endpoints will be registered using HOST_IPV6 as the
address.

There is no support for "4+6", more work is required for that.

HOST_IPV6 - if SERVICE_IP_VERSION=6 this must be an IPv6
address configured on the system.

Some existing services, like the Openvswitch agent, will continue
to use IPv4 addresses for things like tunnel endpoints.  This is
a current restriction in the code and can be updated at a later
time.  This change is just a first step to supporting IPv6-only
control and data planes in devstack.

This change is also partly based on two previous patches,
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140519/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176898/

Change-Id: I5c0b775490ce54ab104fd5e89b20fb700212ae74
Co-Authored-By: Sean Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>
Co-Authored-By: Baodong Li <baoli@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sridhar Gaddam <sridhar.gaddam@enovance.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Kacmarsky <adam.kacmarsky@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Alvis <jeremy.alvis@hp.com>

commit_message:
Ensure radosgw service enabled on boot

Currently, we are not ensuring that the radowgw service is enabled to
start on boot. This change removes the restart_rados.sh and adds
enable_rados.pp to ensure the service is running and will be started
on boot.

Change-Id: I58bf4a20c9d08ba3e9624fd47e3b5780011c89b7
Closes-Bug: 1466552
(cherry picked from commit 23243f3c9f865bd329ed1e65ea5198f46e46b2ac)

commit_message:
Adapt synced horizon module

  * add new parameters:
    cache_backend, cache_options
    upstream change-id I7484727fd2af26d47bc0f59e59b7f6f75daf1092
  * replace keystone_host, keystone_scheme by keystone_url
  * add noop tests for new parameters
  * replace local_settings.py.erb from openstack module
    with horizon module template
  * Add MOS specific settings
    ENABLED_QUOTA_GROUPS to horizon local_settings.py.erb
  * drop -- clear flag from collectstatic, bug 1470993
  * change cache_backend due to bug 1469203

Partially Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules
Change-Id: Idc7f821e1e710dd868677e6e3c3486215367c559

commit_message:
This commit fixes https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1253565
and consists of the following key changes
* Apply minimal changes to filenames, enabling later addition of hypervisor
  support using Xen+libvirt, renaming XenServer files using git mv
  - section_introduction-to-xen.xml > section_hypervisor_xen_xapi.xml
  - section_xen-install.xml > section_xapi-install.xml
  - section_compute-configure-xen.xml > section_compute-configure-xapi.xml
  All XenServer docs can now be identified using xapi in the filename.
* Renamed relevant occurances of Xen to XenServer in XenServer docs and the Hypervisor
  page and replaced outdated references to Xen.org with XenProject.org
* Added new page (section_hypervisor_xen_libvirt.xml) with documentation for Xen
  with libvirt and added link to new page from hypervisors and XenServer pages
* Changed URL from introduction-to-xen.html to xen_libvirt.hml in doc/common/
  section_kvm_enable.xml (did not include references in .po and .pot files in
  locale, which are autogenerated)

Change-Id: I4c9595dfc382f7c15db3b7231ca32587f0de124d

subject: YAQL package housekeeping
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-08 11:30:43.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'YAQL package housekeeping

Several minor package improvements:
  * package version removed from setup.cfg, thus making package versions
    tag-based via pbr
  * bumped CLI version to 0.2.7 (still manual in this branch, 1.0
    already does that automatically)
  * returned CLI entrypoint back to setup.cfg (was missing for several
    releases)

Closes-bug: #1463040
Change-Id: I7b09ea18946abbc66c98632b3038b2b94d32a086
'}]
commit_message:
YAQL package housekeeping

Several minor package improvements:
  * package version removed from setup.cfg, thus making package versions
    tag-based via pbr
  * bumped CLI version to 0.2.7 (still manual in this branch, 1.0
    already does that automatically)
  * returned CLI entrypoint back to setup.cfg (was missing for several
    releases)

Closes-bug: #1463040
Change-Id: I7b09ea18946abbc66c98632b3038b2b94d32a086

subject: Fixed compatibility with Ply 3.6
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-08 11:30:43.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'yaql/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Fixed compatibility with Ply 3.6

Ply 3.6 has changed the constraints on tabmodule variable name, it now
may not contain dots.
As the name of tabmodule in yaql 0.2.x is based on the grammar version it
may include dots, thus breaking the parser.

This patch replaces dots to underscores in tabmodule name.

Similar issue was fixed in v1 branch by patch
I4364729223521864f7cda5a932503d7ce1b6fa36

Change-Id: If024e9abe7a08fd9de4c348b3df780de63c10f56
Partial-Bug: #1448990
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed compatibility with Ply 3.6

Ply 3.6 has changed the constraints on tabmodule variable name, it now
may not contain dots.
As the name of tabmodule in yaql 0.2.x is based on the grammar version it
may include dots, thus breaking the parser.

This patch replaces dots to underscores in tabmodule name.

Similar issue was fixed in v1 branch by patch
I4364729223521864f7cda5a932503d7ce1b6fa36

Change-Id: If024e9abe7a08fd9de4c348b3df780de63c10f56
Partial-Bug: #1448990

commit_message:
Adapt synced Heat module for Fuel usage

  Key moments:
    * Fix lint errors
    * Remove duplication of package->service dependencies
    * Workoaround for MySQL module
    * Fix name for heat-engine service in heat_ha class
    * Remove heat_config options from osnailyfacter class
    * Configure delegated roles from heat class
    * Add retries to heat domain creation command
      commit I2fbb97adde6743153fc81f8dba153356c382cb52
    * Add retry to heat_domain_id
      commit: I1630f54cdfa850a6b4dcbc9b714ebc6195de1fb0
    * Update in heat_domain_id_setter
      commit: I4c0df7600e10d57429eda854cd8aa6208e1c6539
    * Add noop tests for new parameters

  Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

Change-Id: Ib9fa8acc54c124f8656d49accbdbbf733f2d3fd3

commit_message:
Adapt synced neutron module

- pass $tunnel_types variable as it's required since Kilo, added noop test
- backported required changes from 6.1 and fixed unit-tests

Partially Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules
Change-Id: Iccb6cbc874ec1ff390bb008fb7ef61bfde4bba3a

commit_message:
Adapt synced Cinder module for Fuel usage

Key moments:
  *Update section for cinder_config
  *Add params for "cinder" class
  *Remove duplicated params for cinder config

Partially Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

Change-Id: Icd537cb4f817fa0e4b2e2ac32eab531dfda6ac1c

commit_message:
Sync cinder with upstream

commit 3e80d4a9f9fbedb03ac21537ba85d66b09531c8b
source https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-cinder

Partially Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules
Fuel-CI: disable

Change-Id: I3f88d35f5cf775e330d52efca617d3302aa7d049

commit_message:
Adapt synced Nova module for Fuel usage

  Key moments:
    * Return implementation of type and provider for nova_floating_range
    * Make package 'bridge-utils' install optional
      commit - I744fe89e8d9dae79a5b822ac1a1ad4cee780bfc4
    * Add workaround for MySQL module
    * Fix duplication errors in openstack module
    * Revise patch for two dns servers
    * Fix lint issues
      commit: 7a4e067e9241a3fffec4b2d521f070f0bea1f50f
    * Add noop tests for new parameters

  Closes-bug: #1468230
  Closes-bug: #1469308

  Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

Change-Id: Ie5732f4976d688f3788cc83d3b1bac7231fcd314

commit_message:
Adapt synced keystone module

  * add new parameters:
    public_url, admin_url, internal_url, mysql_module, token_caching
    cache_backend, revoke_driver
  * replase old parameters with new:
    idle_timeout -> database_idle_timeout
  * installing python-memcache has been moved to module
  * added noop tests for new variables
  * fix pep8 errors

Partially Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules
Change-Id: I33cbabd5e623fc9920107a3f8c2258bd7e47346e

subject: Make py34 job pass successfully
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-08 10:44:38.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/context.py', 'yaql/functions/extended.py', 'yaql/__init__.py', 'yaql/functions/builtin.py'], 'message': 'Make py34 job pass successfully

As py34 job is now voting, no patch to 0.2 branch may land as py34 tests
do not pass in it.

This patch make these tests passable.

NOTE: THIS IS NOT AN INTRODUCTION OF Py34 SUPPORT! YAQL 0.2 STILL DOES
NOT RUN ON Py3x!

This patch will just allow the empty test to properly pass the gate.
Proper py34 support is available on 1.x branch only!

Change-Id: I043b2c0407b25eddc6d527a65d49258a12320219
'}]
commit_message:
Make py34 job pass successfully

As py34 job is now voting, no patch to 0.2 branch may land as py34 tests
do not pass in it.

This patch make these tests passable.

NOTE: THIS IS NOT AN INTRODUCTION OF Py34 SUPPORT! YAQL 0.2 STILL DOES
NOT RUN ON Py3x!

This patch will just allow the empty test to properly pass the gate.
Proper py34 support is available on 1.x branch only!

Change-Id: I043b2c0407b25eddc6d527a65d49258a12320219

commit_message:

Users that want to run the scenario tests available in the Sahara repository

commit_message:
Use Templates for Scenario Tests Configuration

Users that want to run the scenario tests available in the Sahara repository
need to modify the provided YAML files, which are really template files even
if not marked as such. The usability of this process could be improved by
extending the test runner to read the templates and perform the substitution
of the required variables instead.

Change-Id: I5ea728d14a1727c8c6f5c07f320e20fb9b1cb218
Describes: blueprint scenario-test-config-template

subject: Fix Heat 302 redirects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-29 21:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'message': 'Fix Heat 302 redirects

When doing a heat stack-show, Heat initially returns a 302 redirect.
With the existing loadbalancer config for SSL, this results in a
redirect to an http:// address pointing at the SSL port, which
naturally doesn't work.

The fix for this is to use the rsprep haproxy option to rewrite the
Location header in responses from the Heat api server.  This allows
us to properly handle redirect traffic as https.

Also note that http header rewriting requires "mode http", so that
is added here as well.

Change-Id: I7e5c5b1877e9aa46c4b88dfba45c1fddf61727fc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Heat 302 redirects

When doing a heat stack-show, Heat initially returns a 302 redirect.
With the existing loadbalancer config for SSL, this results in a
redirect to an http:// address pointing at the SSL port, which
naturally doesn't work.

The fix for this is to use the rsprep haproxy option to rewrite the
Location header in responses from the Heat api server.  This allows
us to properly handle redirect traffic as https.

Also note that http header rewriting requires "mode http", so that
is added here as well.

Change-Id: I7e5c5b1877e9aa46c4b88dfba45c1fddf61727fc

Closes-Bug:#1472257

subject: Loop to retrieve all reviews
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 12:29:17.000000000', 'files': ['releasestatus.py'], 'message': 'Loop to retrieve all reviews

releasestatus was only making a single query to list all reviews
across all projects, so in those busy days it was missing a whole
lot of review links.

This change introduces per-project queries and sortKey-based loops
to retrieve all the related changes.

Also drops retrieving is:submitted since that is not used at all.

Change-Id: I3d4abc8bc70904ae7c599d8efa3fac956aab702b
'}]
commit_message:
Loop to retrieve all reviews

releasestatus was only making a single query to list all reviews
across all projects, so in those busy days it was missing a whole
lot of review links.

This change introduces per-project queries and sortKey-based loops
to retrieve all the related changes.

Also drops retrieving is:submitted since that is not used at all.

Change-Id: I3d4abc8bc70904ae7c599d8efa3fac956aab702b

subject: Fix some cluster-list option bugs
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-08 09:16:43.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix some cluster-list option bugs

This patch renames the --show-deleted option to -d and the --sort-dir to
-s. The reason is to keep the option names consistent across different

It also fixes the supports to sort_keys and sort_dir.

Change-Id: I2e10e341eccfdbc440ab1b2da8c005a485cdc08d

commit_message:
Fix some cluster-list option bugs

This patch renames the --show-deleted option to -d and the --sort-dir to
-s. The reason is to keep the option names consistent across different
object types.

It also fixes the supports to sort_keys and sort_dir.

Change-Id: I2e10e341eccfdbc440ab1b2da8c005a485cdc08d

commit_message:
Allow suspend and resume again if failed last time

Now heat doesn't support to suspend or resume again
if failed last time, if a stack in SUSPEND_FAILED or
RESUME_FAILED, then user can neither suspend nor resume.

Change-Id: I84a2ff32265a66e9018a62ea0ee20b9415f109e7

revisions:

test_share_create_failed check that check_create_complete
raises ResourceInError exception, but there is no necessity
to create whole resource, because if ResourceInError has been
raised, heat tries to recreate stack, thereforce
test_share_create_failed runs 68 seconds. Now test only checks
correct raising ResourceInError in check_create_complete.

Also, test_share_create_unknown_status was refactored in such way.

Change-Id: I5093a49bda00c676ef805dff1ecfb2e2db803a9c'}]
commit_message:
Refactor test_share_create_failed test for Manila

test_share_create_failed check that check_create_complete
raises ResourceInError exception, but there is no necessity
to create whole resource, because if ResourceInError has been
raised, heat tries to recreate stack, thereforce
test_share_create_failed runs 68 seconds. Now test only checks
correct raising ResourceInError in check_create_complete.

Also, test_share_create_unknown_status was refactored in such way.

Change-Id: I5093a49bda00c676ef805dff1ecfb2e2db803a9c

subject: Removed the non-existent method call
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 7806, 'name': 'Sushil Kumar', 'email': 'skm.net@gmail.com', 'username': 'sushilkm'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 9746, 'name': 'Doug Shelley', 'email': 'dougshelley66@gmail.com', 'username': 'dougshelley'}, {'_account_id': 12484, 'name': 'jazeltq', 'email': 'tianqing@unitedstack.com', 'username': 'litianqing'}, {'_account_id': 12758, 'name': 'Masaki Matsushita', 'email': 'glass.saga@gmail.com', 'username': 'masaki'}, {'_account_id': 14576, 'name': 'Petr Malik', 'email': 'pmalik@tesora.com', 'username': 'pmalik'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-01 10:28:06.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_vertica_clusters.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_api.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbaas.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/cluster/test_cluster_controller.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/cluster/test_cluster_vertica_controller.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/cluster/test_cluster.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/cluster/test_vertica_cluster.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_models.py'], 'message': 'Removed the non-existent method call

<mock_object>.<method>.assert_called/<mock_object>.assert_called()
has been called at many places to assert the execution of method.

However, any such method does not exist(discussed in detail in bug).

Replaced <mock_object>.<method>.assert_called/<mock_object>.assert_called()
by <mock_object>.<method>.assert_called_with(*args, **kwargs).

There is one more benefit of using assert_called_with that
we have verified the exact argumens which were used in method call.

After correcting this found more bugs about invalid asserts,
which were working earlier because of mocked method call,
which started failing.
Corrected these bugs, too.

Change-Id: I638e38245676cffdffacb8e4d8316ed18acb1fa3
Closes-Bug: #1469812
'}]
commit_message:
Removed the non-existent method call

<mock_object>.<method>.assert_called/<mock_object>.assert_called()
has been called at many places to assert the execution of method.

However, any such method does not exist(discussed in detail in bug).

Replaced <mock_object>.<method>.assert_called/<mock_object>.assert_called()
by <mock_object>.<method>.assert_called_with(*args, **kwargs).

There is one more benefit of using assert_called_with that
we have verified the exact argumens which were used in method call.

After correcting this found more bugs about invalid asserts,
which were working earlier because of mocked method call,
which started failing.
Corrected these bugs, too.

Change-Id: I638e38245676cffdffacb8e4d8316ed18acb1fa3
Closes-Bug: #1469812

commit_message:
Add Meiji to glossary

Update glossary with Meiji as next release name.
Criteria for the release name was "locations in Tokyo" and thus it's
named after Meiji park and/or Meiji shrine.

Update Liberty to change tense to past tense.
Update Release name list.

Change-Id: I45b0396b1c552f6ded73da3f0c496c18dc23ea4c

commit_message:
Don't set heat_stack_user_role to empty string

This value doesn't work, and the default of heat_stack_user is fine.

See https://github.com/openstack/puppet-heat/blob/989ffa65f4339bfd9612cff3b5ddcc4fd301f695/manifests/engine.pp#L22
Resolves: rhbz#1238844

Change-Id: I247121cb91d2b2a34f0f9f769fb411fcbfe6b571

commit_message:
Remove all of the rpc_release.link files

This removes the link files that are powering the basic pip config
thoughout the stack. The removal is to ensure that there are no
conflicting sources of truth when upgrading from Juno.

Closes-Bug: #1450580
Change-Id: I074f46c9b35793b35cf22ab49dd97f938df0cfac
(cherry picked from commit 0f4b5c9e6e96189a2404a40d45bdc78419b264f7)

commit_message:
Allow addition of hooks without overriding defaults

This patch adds the default_processsing_hooks config option, so that
operators can add processing hooks before or after the defaults
without having to override the defaults themselves.

Change-Id: Ib25c358db8950e6cfca7ae0aea0641cd11e094a5
Closes-Bug: #1441117

commit_message:
Add tags to openstack-doc-tools

openstack-doc-tools is manged by the release-team, like
openstackdocstheme.
It is also not a service but a "piece of software that is used to build
another project" and thus add type:library to it.

commit_message:
Add murano-deployment to Murano

subject: Make --show-deleted and --sort-dir option names consistent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 08:25:30.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': "Make --show-deleted and --sort-dir option names consistent

We were using -d for --show-deleted and -s for --sort-dir sometimes, and
we were also using -s for --show-deleted and -d for --sort-dir in other
places. This is inconsistent. The command line also reserved -d for
--debug, that will be an even worse problem.

This patch proposes a solution:

  use '-D' for '--show-deleted' all the time;
  use '-s' for '--sort-dir' all the time;
  reserve '-d' for '--debug'.

Change-Id: I8dbe88f71e2541f2b4273c5add76a3cc6b0dbebd
"}]
commit_message:
Make --show-deleted and --sort-dir option names consistent

We were using -d for --show-deleted and -s for --sort-dir sometimes, and
we were also using -s for --show-deleted and -d for --sort-dir in other
places. This is inconsistent. The command line also reserved -d for
--debug, that will be an even worse problem.

This patch proposes a solution:

  use '-D' for '--show-deleted' all the time;
  use '-s' for '--sort-dir' all the time;
  reserve '-d' for '--debug'.

Change-Id: I8dbe88f71e2541f2b4273c5add76a3cc6b0dbebd

subject: Fix minor error in node-list command
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-08 08:18:29.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix minor error in node-list command

Fixing several issues found in node-list command

1) The node-list help message was not displaying the meta variables in a
consistent manner. This patch makes the cluster parameter carry a proper
meta variable name.

2) The --show-deleted option should be abbreviated as -D, to be
consistent with profile-list, cluster-list, etc.

Change-Id: Ief43df3184037227126e73f7d6a88b168b7b453b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix minor error in node-list command

Fixing several issues found in node-list command

1) The node-list help message was not displaying the meta variables in a
consistent manner. This patch makes the cluster parameter carry a proper
meta variable name.

2) The --show-deleted option should be abbreviated as -D, to be
consistent with profile-list, cluster-list, etc.

Change-Id: Ief43df3184037227126e73f7d6a88b168b7b453b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-19 12:12:02.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/heat/heat.pp'], 'message': 'Fix amqp_hosts for heat

W/o this patch amqp_hosts is being passed
to heat as array with single element containing
a string with all amqp hosts listed separeted by a comma.
This is wrong as by desgin, the heat module expects
them to be listed as array elements instead. This
leads to ha_queues configured always to False
breaking Heat HA operations.

The fix is to split amql_hosts before to pass it
to the heat class

Closes-bug: #1465840

Change-Id: Ief0266d468bf127156db8c42c86b840436090ab8
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix amqp_hosts for heat

W/o this patch amqp_hosts is being passed
to heat as array with single element containing
a string with all amqp hosts listed separeted by a comma.
This is wrong as by desgin, the heat module expects
them to be listed as array elements instead. This
leads to ha_queues configured always to False
breaking Heat HA operations.

The fix is to split amql_hosts before to pass it
to the heat class

Closes-bug: #1465840

Change-Id: Ief0266d468bf127156db8c42c86b840436090ab8
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Remove unused static (binary) files from manifest tree

due http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/064287.html
any binary files are stored in the files/ hierarchy
and will be packaged while ISO creates.

Change-Id: I61740aa35dc13513e5a365a3363f357035f29a80
(cherry picked from commit de437327149c30a946c8da20bbbfcbdddcbf7034)

commit_message:
Bump oslo.messaging to greater than or equal to 1.11.0

The RequestContextSerializer and JsonPayloadSerializer have been
implemented in oslo_messaging in v1.11.0, this change will allow
reducing the re-implementation in others projects.

Change-Id: Iea45668ccdb705b1e7de9f328207a0973250ea79
Closes-Bug: 1467524

The final check during the prep stage, where `puppet module list` is
run so that its output can be used for debugging, should run on the
current host in the loop, not the first host in the array.

Change-Id: I664f50fd323cfc0e3828f4198d10ff4a1b50b8b2
'}]
commit_message:
Correct `puppet module list` check in beaker

The final check during the prep stage, where `puppet module list` is
run so that its output can be used for debugging, should run on the
current host in the loop, not the first host in the array.

Change-Id: I664f50fd323cfc0e3828f4198d10ff4a1b50b8b2

commit_message:
Use schemaless approach for node roles

In Fuel 7.0 we want to have ability to extend node roles on fly by using
plugins. In order to achieve this, we want to have declarative
schemaless approach, so we won't require database object manipulations
(CRUD) each time we somehow change node role.

This commit drops such tables like:

* roles
* pending_roles
* node_roles

and use postgresql arrays in nodes tables instead:

* roles
* pending_roles
* primary_roles

Implements blueprint role-as-a-plugin

Change-Id: I2d3fccb7187fa4e82595c9ca6b27ef8ce90ee4b2
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Variablize the full iPXE binary

The full ipxe binary has a different name on RedHat based
based distributions, so we need to variablize the parameter
and load the correct variable accordingly.

Change-Id: Icc6f3229ed54544794b57fe26d5293724e392647

Apparently older iPXE implementations that may be burned into
ROMs may not recognize the template MAC syntax, and thus be unable to
boot.

In the event of this happening, we should attempt to chainload the
iPXE image.

Additionally removed autofree as this may not be recognized by
some versions of iPXE.

Change-Id: I6e458d6a9383fb2d31d743b0124384a2036520df
'}]
commit_message:
Attempt to upgrade iPXE if no mac found

Apparently older iPXE implementations that may be burned into
ROMs may not recognize the template MAC syntax, and thus be unable to
boot.

In the event of this happening, we should attempt to chainload the
iPXE image.

Additionally removed autofree as this may not be recognized by
some versions of iPXE.

Change-Id: I6e458d6a9383fb2d31d743b0124384a2036520df

commit_message:
Fix Quobyte driver secure permissions issue

Change nas_secure_file_permissions to
insecure mode in order to prevent permission denied errors
when accessing the
Nova API for snapshot operations.

Fixes Bug: 1438603

Change-Id: I9fde0ee06b406679ccbb85885f421c1ec4418f10

commit_message:
Expanded assertion in test_create_token for keystone v2, v3

TokensTest.test_create_token and TokensV3Test.test_create_token
tests had very small validation of created token.
Added more assertion to TokensTest.test_create_token and
TokensV3Test.test_create_token tests.
Tests validate token expiration, token type, its user's name, id.
For Keystone V3 there is also validateion for method of token.

Change-Id: Iaf7755168d662d44c5b3ff72ca93c6cd72425e45

commit_message:
Imported Translations from Transifex

For more information about this automatic import see:

commit_message:
Change request mocking in tests to be on session

The requests.request method redirects to the requests.Session.request
method internally. Mocking on the session instead makes it easier to
integrate with keystoneauth.

Fixes issues with the mocking on python3 using text types instead of
bytes.

Change-Id: I16ae4c00c41f119fa32538ba48955d9eddf65055

subject: Add CORS unit tests to base
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 12279, 'name': 'Janie Richling', 'email': 'jrichli@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jrichli'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-08 04:55:00.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_base.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'Add CORS unit tests to base

In earlier versions of swift when a request was made with an
existing origin, but without any CORS settings in the container,
it was possible to get an unhandled exception due to a method call
on the "None" return of cors.get('allow_origin', '').

Unit tests have been added to assert that this problem cannot go
undetected again.

Change-Id: Ia74896dabe1cf5a307c551b15a43ab1fd789c213
Fixes: bug 1468782
'}]
commit_message:
Add CORS unit tests to base

In earlier versions of swift when a request was made with an
existing origin, but without any CORS settings in the container,
it was possible to get an unhandled exception due to a method call
on the "None" return of cors.get('allow_origin', '').

Unit tests have been added to assert that this problem cannot go
undetected again.

Change-Id: Ia74896dabe1cf5a307c551b15a43ab1fd789c213
Fixes: bug 1468782

commit_message:
update ceilometermiddleware sample target

current tests target storage.api.request meter. this meter is
being deprecated as part of the initiative to represent measurement
data as samples and non-measurement data as events[1]. this is to avoid
unnecessary calculations where volume is hardcoded to volume=1.
the correct meter derived from an upload notification from the
middleware should be storage.objects.incoming.bytes

[1] I654f657dd36967ad3ec99bbe06209e7745432e12

Change-Id: I8443ab9c1dc813bf0cc36f5195887f74e72f5859

The code for ensuring that smallfiles = true and bind_ip is cleared is
incorrect.

On deb platforms smallfiles was absent, so the sed code was doing

Delete the lines completely, then append the smallfiles = true line.

Change-Id: Ie42afe89b1fb2ac43d61008f580cebb5f6cf522a
Closes-bug: #1468459'}]
commit_message:
MongoDB smallfiles/bind_ip settings not working properly

The code for ensuring that smallfiles = true and bind_ip is cleared is
incorrect.

On deb platforms smallfiles was absent, so the sed code was doing
nothing.

Delete the lines completely, then append the smallfiles = true line.

Change-Id: Ie42afe89b1fb2ac43d61008f580cebb5f6cf522a
Closes-bug: #1468459

subject: Convergence: Compute resource dependencies
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-07 07:27:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/worker.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': 'Convergence: Compute resource dependencies

1. Resource requires need to be computed from the input data supplied by
sync point. Since the replacement impersonates the replaced, we need to
get the requires from input data rather than from the graph key. The
graph key will still have old (replaced) resource and input data will
have correct requires.

2. Resources are always INITed with correct template, that they belong
to, so there is no need to pass template ID again to create or delete.

Co-Authored-By: Rakesh HS  <rh-s@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kanagaraj Manickam  <kanagaraj.manickam@hp.com>

Change-Id: I706cf02b438f19d3e1a59b3e8ca5ebe6b3e60328
'}]
commit_message:
Convergence: Compute resource dependencies

1. Resource requires need to be computed from the input data supplied by
sync point. Since the replacement impersonates the replaced, we need to
get the requires from input data rather than from the graph key. The
graph key will still have old (replaced) resource and input data will
have correct requires.

2. Resources are always INITed with correct template, that they belong
to, so there is no need to pass template ID again to create or delete.

Co-Authored-By: Rakesh HS  <rh-s@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kanagaraj Manickam  <kanagaraj.manickam@hp.com>

Change-Id: I706cf02b438f19d3e1a59b3e8ca5ebe6b3e60328

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-04 23:08:05.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db_replicator.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db.py', 'swift/container/replicator.py'], 'message': "Fix reclaim on deleted containers

The common db replicator's code path for reclaiming deleted db's beyond the
reclaim age was not covered by unittests, and a AttributeError snuck in.  In
writing the test that would cover the common code both for accounts and
containers I discovered another KeyError with the container conditional for
validating the container's fully reported status.

This fixes both those issues and adds additional tests for the cleanup empty
account container partition and suffix directories.

Change-Id: I2a1bfaefebd05b01231bf71dd908fcc49adb4c36
"}]
commit_message:
Fix reclaim on deleted containers

The common db replicator's code path for reclaiming deleted db's beyond the
reclaim age was not covered by unittests, and a AttributeError snuck in.  In
writing the test that would cover the common code both for accounts and
containers I discovered another KeyError with the container conditional for
validating the container's fully reported status.

This fixes both those issues and adds additional tests for the cleanup empty
account container partition and suffix directories.

Change-Id: I2a1bfaefebd05b01231bf71dd908fcc49adb4c36

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-07-03 07:50:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/floating_ip_dns.py', 'nova/tests/unit/fake_policy.py', 'etc/nova/policy.json', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_floating_ip_dns.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/floating_ip_dns.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_manager.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for floating_ip_dns

This patches removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
floating_ip_dns.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

SecurityImpact
UpgradeImpact:
Due to the db layer permission checks are removed, we need to add default
policy rule into policy file. In this patch,
"os_compute_api:os-floating-ip-dns:domain:update" and
"os_compute_api:os-floating-ip-dns:domain:delete" were updated with a default
rule. Admin will be notfied to update their policy configure file to keep
the behavior as before.

Change-Id: Ibddf3529a219cb9a0c1d4cfdb89327b53454c436
'}]
commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for floating_ip_dns

This patches removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
floating_ip_dns.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

SecurityImpact
UpgradeImpact:
Due to the db layer permission checks are removed, we need to add default
policy rule into policy file. In this patch,
"os_compute_api:os-floating-ip-dns:domain:update" and
"os_compute_api:os-floating-ip-dns:domain:delete" were updated with a default
rule. Admin will be notfied to update their policy configure file to keep
the behavior as before.

Change-Id: Ibddf3529a219cb9a0c1d4cfdb89327b53454c436

commit_message:
Add a new crypt method using cryptography

This updates the default crypt method to use the cryptography module
instead of the oslo crypto utils module. It also refactors decrypt to
remove some duplication.

This new patch fixes an issue with small keys.

Change-Id: I3ef166d15306693f0589903785102a359834c307
Closes-Bug: #1468025

commit_message:
Refactoring of the os-services module

Main purpose of the change is to extract enable/disable/disable with log
reason methods out of update method.

Also, there are couple of code style fixes and one potential issue with
overriding services imported from scheme.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mark-host-down

Change-Id: I529b585efc4d7e775e5a60f9a3e47d204aa1732d

subject: Remove fileutils from oslo-incubator
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-07 20:49:58.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/openstack/common/README', 'keystone/openstack/__init__.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/fileutils.py', 'keystone/contrib/federation/idp.py', 'keystone/contrib/federation/utils.py', 'openstack-common.conf', 'keystone/openstack/common/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Remove fileutils from oslo-incubator

The only function being used from oslo-incubator is
write_to_tempfile, which is being used in idp.py.

fileutils was recently graduated to oslo.policy and oslo.utils,
with file_open() and write_to_tempfile() NOT graduated.

We should include the small function in our own code, since
keystone is the only project using the function.

Change-Id: Ie5731a8f7b393ed8d6025ddf7d722c7688a42b3d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove fileutils from oslo-incubator

The only function being used from oslo-incubator is
write_to_tempfile, which is being used in idp.py.

fileutils was recently graduated to oslo.policy and oslo.utils,
with file_open() and write_to_tempfile() NOT graduated.

We should include the small function in our own code, since
keystone is the only project using the function.

Change-Id: Ie5731a8f7b393ed8d6025ddf7d722c7688a42b3d

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-07 17:46:17.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developing.rst'], 'message': 'Modified command used to run keystone-all.

The keystone-all file no longer exists in bin/, but it is automatically
created when Keystone is installed. It was never removed as this bug
originally suggested.

Removing "bin/" from the command 'tools/with_venv.sh bin/keystone-all'
will make with_venv.sh use the keystone-all from the created virtualenv.

Change-Id: I04695f0548d6f87d632b87a40834323fea1378d7
Co-Authored-By: Akshay Aggarwal <akshayx.aggarwal@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jason O'Brien <jasonx.obrien@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1462242
'}]
commit_message:
Modified command used to run keystone-all.

The keystone-all file no longer exists in bin/, but it is automatically
created when Keystone is installed. It was never removed as this bug
originally suggested.

Removing "bin/" from the command 'tools/with_venv.sh bin/keystone-all'
will make with_venv.sh use the keystone-all from the created virtualenv.

Change-Id: I04695f0548d6f87d632b87a40834323fea1378d7
Co-Authored-By: Akshay Aggarwal <akshayx.aggarwal@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jason O'Brien <jasonx.obrien@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1462242

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-24 07:58:43.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/fixed_ips.py', 'tempest/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/parameter_types.py', 'tempest/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/hypervisors.py', 'tempest/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/interfaces.py', 'tempest/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/floating_ips.py'], 'message': "Support for ipv6 in compute response JSON schema

JSON schema Draft-4 has changed the format 'ip-address' to 'ipv4'
and provide separate format for 'ipv6'.
http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-validation.html#anchor120

Current compute response schemas have 'ip-address' format for address
validation which only cover ipv4.

Those schema should support 'ipv6' format also.

This commit adds support for ipv6 address in schemas.
Also change 'anyOf' to 'oneOf' for address formating validation.

Closes-Bug: 1460984

Change-Id: I64883306235dc3b90a3a878674532f77d825d5c4
"}]
commit_message:
Support for ipv6 in compute response JSON schema

JSON schema Draft-4 has changed the format 'ip-address' to 'ipv4'
and provide separate format for 'ipv6'.
http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-validation.html#anchor120

Current compute response schemas have 'ip-address' format for address
validation which only cover ipv4.

Those schema should support 'ipv6' format also.

This commit adds support for ipv6 address in schemas.
Also change 'anyOf' to 'oneOf' for address formating validation.

Closes-Bug: 1460984

Change-Id: I64883306235dc3b90a3a878674532f77d825d5c4

1. There is no back-up stack which can take care of deleting the old
resources after the stack update is done. The DB objects, in convergence
model, needs to be deleted up front after they have been deleted from

2. When the stack fails, do not delete the previous template. There

3. Resource unlock should use the boolean return value instead of

commit_message:
Convergence: Handling resouce clean-up

1. There is no back-up stack which can take care of deleting the old
resources after the stack update is done. The DB objects, in convergence
model, needs to be deleted up front after they have been deleted from
real world.

2. When the stack fails, do not delete the previous template. There
might be resource from previous template in DB that are not yet deleted.

3. Resource unlock should use the boolean return value instead of
integer.

Change-Id: I49cc319638c81833c6c544c53e8c321e358e9744
Co-Authored-By: Sirushti Murugesan <sirushti.murugesan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Anant Patil <anant.patil@hp.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-03 05:38:50.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_provider_template.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py'], 'message': 'Missing template file on update fails silently

When the template file for a template/facade/provider resource is
not found in the new files list when doing a stack update, Heat
silently falls back to using the existing template (i.e. so no
change will be made).
The cause is that the update code shares the same code path for
obtaining the template as the init code. The init code needs to
have a fallback, so that loading the (parent) stack never fails,
however in the update case it is undesirable.

Change-Id: Id12b63d9f04caba8e9325aed0ee2acf51ffe0c4c
Closes-Bug: #1452520
(cherry picked from commit 0c83c6f5ede0bf5d46779058ed5bea00629d5a3b)
'}]
commit_message:
Missing template file on update fails silently

When the template file for a template/facade/provider resource is
not found in the new files list when doing a stack update, Heat
silently falls back to using the existing template (i.e. so no
change will be made).
The cause is that the update code shares the same code path for
obtaining the template as the init code. The init code needs to
have a fallback, so that loading the (parent) stack never fails,
however in the update case it is undesirable.

Change-Id: Id12b63d9f04caba8e9325aed0ee2acf51ffe0c4c
Closes-Bug: #1452520
(cherry picked from commit 0c83c6f5ede0bf5d46779058ed5bea00629d5a3b)

revisions:

The constraints generation job script uses zuul-cloner, so set
ZUUL_BRANCH since it's run from a periodic pipeline where Zuul
doesn't provide the ZUUL_BRANCH nor ZUUL_REF job parameters
zuul-cloner requires.

Change-Id: I65d3aa38eb45cfbecf13561d3af4b4e0235f2f5d
"}]
commit_message:
Provide ZUUL_BRANCH in constraints generation job

The constraints generation job script uses zuul-cloner, so set
ZUUL_BRANCH since it's run from a periodic pipeline where Zuul
doesn't provide the ZUUL_BRANCH nor ZUUL_REF job parameters
zuul-cloner requires.

Change-Id: I65d3aa38eb45cfbecf13561d3af4b4e0235f2f5d

commit_message:
Implemented DictCacheBackend

This backend is based on dictionary and memorycache client from
https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/openstack/common/memorycache.py

This backend was implemented to be used in Nova
because there is no appropriate default backend in dogpile.

Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kholkin <pkholkin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ie3e6c8a3671bc28bfd6967e8758c1419c3c8d501

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated properties in horizon.

Horizon will show the neutron advanced services depending on if
these services are enabled. The former properties enable_lb,
enable_vpn, and enable_firewall will be deprecated since Kilo.
Remove them from cookbook.

Change-Id: I3f2a77956381b8e8cc0a897ad79395063e246855
Closes-Bug: #1459576

subject: update devstack plugin for keystone v3 and fix kazoo version
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-07 21:28:21.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'contrib/devstack/lib/cue', 'tests/integration/common/client.py'], 'message': 'update devstack plugin for keystone v3 and fix kazoo version

Devstack changed to using keystone v3 by default, which requires domain
rather than project names when creating users and roles.  Updating cue
plugin to use the "default" domain rather than the service tenant

Also fixing kazoo to pypi released versions as the released version now
works with taskflow.

Also modifying tests/integration/common/client.py to switch from
tempest.services.compute.json.TenantNetworksClientJSON to
tempest.services.compute.json.TenantNetworksClient due to change in
tempest.

Change-Id: I7a61f77c4cb52be9474fa515d03fd89618019e35
'}]
commit_message:
update devstack plugin for keystone v3 and fix kazoo version

Devstack changed to using keystone v3 by default, which requires domain
rather than project names when creating users and roles.  Updating cue
plugin to use the "default" domain rather than the service tenant

Also fixing kazoo to pypi released versions as the released version now
works with taskflow.

Also modifying tests/integration/common/client.py to switch from
tempest.services.compute.json.TenantNetworksClientJSON to
tempest.services.compute.json.TenantNetworksClient due to change in
tempest.

Change-Id: I7a61f77c4cb52be9474fa515d03fd89618019e35

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-01 14:54:36.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py', 'doc/source/template_guide/hot_spec.rst', 'heat/engine/hot/template.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': 'Add str_split function to HOT 2015-10-15

Adds a new intrinsic function to split strings into lists, and optionally
return a specific list item by index (similar to get_attr/get_param path
based attributes).

Syntax is:

str_split: [",", "apples,pears"]

which returns ["apples", "pears"]

Or with an optional index:

str_split: [",", "apples,pears", 1]

which returns "pears"

Change-Id: Ibc7a315bee278b8a49e44475206361b639536688
blueprint: str-split
'}]
commit_message:
Add str_split function to HOT 2015-10-15

Adds a new intrinsic function to split strings into lists, and optionally
return a specific list item by index (similar to get_attr/get_param path
based attributes).

Syntax is:

str_split: [",", "apples,pears"]

which returns ["apples", "pears"]

Or with an optional index:

str_split: [",", "apples,pears", 1]

which returns "pears"

Change-Id: Ibc7a315bee278b8a49e44475206361b639536688
blueprint: str-split

commit_message:
Conditionally expose resources based on available services

If the required keystone service for a given resource does
not exist in the keystone catalog, raises
StackResourceUnavailable.

It will be effective only if default_client_name is defined
in the given resource.

It also fixes other test cases, where is_service_available
needs to be returning True

implements blueprint keystone-based-resource-availability
Closes-bug: #1388047

Change-Id: I92afa9ffc3a3333b46dc25921cf7f982777cba76

commit_message:
Make ssync_sender a better HTTP client

When a server responses with an error - if that error includes a body - the
client should read the body.  This cleans up some ugly eventlet/wsgi.server log
output related to chunked transfer disconnect (invalid literal for int() with
base 16).

Change-Id: Ibd06ddee9f216fce07fa33c3a7d8306b59eb6d77
Closes-Bug: #1466138

commit_message:
After the .durable has been written, fsync the directory.

Added try-except statements in _finalize_durable() to fsync the directory
after a successful fsync of the .durable file.

Added test_commit_fsync_dir_raises_DiskFileErrors() for testing whether
certain assertions hold for the change to include fsync_dir().

Some more error details have been included in the logger.

Closes-Bug: #1470651
Change-Id: I4791d75ade8542678369ba0811ef39af6e955cc6

This patch improves the readability on how Horizon's application

2) Horizon's built-in modules, including modules from `framework`

3) Horizon's plug-in modules - modules from Horizon's extensions

Horizon's built-in modules are managed as a couple of trees, then only

Closes-Bug: #1472098

commit_message:
Improving readability for Horizon top module structure

This patch improves the readability on how Horizon's application
level module `hz.app` is composited and how its dependency modules
are organized.  The dependency modules come from three sources:

1) Library modules - modules defined in third-party libraries,
   including angular's extensions
2) Horizon's built-in modules, including modules from `framework`
   components and modules from `openstack_dashboard` application
   core components.
3) Horizon's plug-in modules - modules from Horizon's extensions
   components via Horizon's plug-in mechanism.

Horizon's built-in modules are managed as a couple of trees, then only
the top modules of each tree should be listed in the Horizon's built-in
modules.

Change-Id: I989a0b5cc8b24f6b168629f4a8fa5e485dcf1a2d
Closes-Bug: #1472098

commit_message:
Do not specify 'objectClass' twice in LDAP filter string.

BaseLdap._ldap_get_all() adds it anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1471446
Change-Id: I6c5545d4a0db8e9ccf53da27b0ea4c45b960330a

commit_message:
Add localboot support for iscsi_irmc driver

This adds localboot support for iscsi_irmc driver
by enabling it to recognize boot_option in
it's vendor passthru and set boot device to disk.

Implements: blueprint local-boot-support-with-partition-images
Change-Id: I23ef0172d91d4e71b121d8f5b15d84f69179ef8b

revisions:
[{'number': 28, 'created': '2015-07-02 04:27:07.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/volume-migration-improvement.rst'], 'message': 'Volume migration improvement for Liberty version

This spec proposes to make volume migration more stable, robust and
user friendly in terms of adding the following features.
 * A better volume status management
 * Migration progress indication
 * An efficient way of migration
 * Migration status and migration progress look up
 * Notification to Ceilometer
 * Tempest tests & CI support, and so on.

All the cases within this spec are targeted to the available volume.
There is going to be another spec to cover the issues regarding the
attached volume.

Related-BP: migration-improvement
Change-Id: I05ba531a18ba416e8b07c8a4165f5e1f7f5e44aa
'}]
commit_message:
Volume migration improvement for Liberty version

This spec proposes to make volume migration more stable, robust and
user friendly in terms of adding the following features.
 * A better volume status management
 * Migration progress indication
 * An efficient way of migration
 * Migration status and migration progress look up
 * Notification to Ceilometer
 * Tempest tests & CI support, and so on.

All the cases within this spec are targeted to the available volume.
There is going to be another spec to cover the issues regarding the
attached volume.

Related-BP: migration-improvement
Change-Id: I05ba531a18ba416e8b07c8a4165f5e1f7f5e44aa

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-06 02:55:49.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/irmc/test_deploy.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/irmc/deploy.py'], 'message': 'Add whole disk image support for iscsi_irmc driver

This adds local boot capability to whole disk deployed image
in addition to partition deployed image in iscsi_ilo driver.
The primary change is to set a bare metal node to boot from
local disk at the end of deployment if the deployed image is a
whole disk image.

Implements: blueprint whole-disk-image-support
Change-Id: Ia7d0156511048eb45b52d573d25a546d84cc6875
'}]
commit_message:
Add whole disk image support for iscsi_irmc driver

This adds local boot capability to whole disk deployed image
in addition to partition deployed image in iscsi_ilo driver.
The primary change is to set a bare metal node to boot from
local disk at the end of deployment if the deployed image is a
whole disk image.

Implements: blueprint whole-disk-image-support
Change-Id: Ia7d0156511048eb45b52d573d25a546d84cc6875

subject: Add ANSI color to heredoc output
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-07 21:37:11.000000000', 'files': ['install_rally.sh'], 'message': 'Add ANSI color to heredoc output

Install rally script uses heredoc (cat < __EOF__) in lots of
places so to make output more verbose, added bash ansi colors
to it. The warnings and errors are formatted in RED while options
and success message is shown in GREEN. After formatted output,
NO_COLOR is applied to change it back to normal.
For more info on bash ansi colors, see:
http://misc.flogisoft.com/bash/tip_colors_and_formatting

Change-Id: Ic105c3938137fe29359d2a4e543e47a95829f777
'}]
commit_message:
Add ANSI color to heredoc output

Install rally script uses heredoc (cat < __EOF__) in lots of
places so to make output more verbose, added bash ansi colors
to it. The warnings and errors are formatted in RED while options
and success message is shown in GREEN. After formatted output,
NO_COLOR is applied to change it back to normal.
For more info on bash ansi colors, see:
http://misc.flogisoft.com/bash/tip_colors_and_formatting

Change-Id: Ic105c3938137fe29359d2a4e543e47a95829f777

subject: This is a merge  of 2 commits to pass gate testing
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-07 23:03:12.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper_system.rb', 'spec/system/ceph_rgw_keystone_spec.rb', 'spec/defines/ceph_rgw_keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/rgw/keystone.pp', 'manifests/params.pp'], 'message': "This is a merge  of 2 commits to pass gate testing

The 1st commit's message was:

define ceph::rgw::keystone.

Provides keystone configuration for the ceph radosgw (additional
parameters in ceph.conf).

Includes rspec puppet and rspec system tests for validation.

Closes-Bug: #1362642
Implements: blueprint rgw keystone

The 2nd commit's message was:

Fix rgw keystone to use correct URL/API string

radosgw adds the keystone version to the url itself when contacting
keystone, therefore specifiying it as part of the url lead to failures
as it was doubled, i.e. something like this
http://keystone.example.com:5000/v2.0/v2.0

At the same time cleaning up the tests, so they can be run as part
of a suite without influencing later tests.

Co-Authored-By: Ricardo Rocha <rocha.porto@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I42cccd6c79619bd14c411f43fc179a8f58ceb22e
"}]
commit_message:
This is a merge  of 2 commits to pass gate testing

The 1st commit's message was:

define ceph::rgw::keystone.

Provides keystone configuration for the ceph radosgw (additional
parameters in ceph.conf).

Includes rspec puppet and rspec system tests for validation.

Closes-Bug: #1362642
Implements: blueprint rgw keystone

The 2nd commit's message was:

Fix rgw keystone to use correct URL/API string

radosgw adds the keystone version to the url itself when contacting
keystone, therefore specifiying it as part of the url lead to failures
as it was doubled, i.e. something like this
http://keystone.example.com:5000/v2.0/v2.0

At the same time cleaning up the tests, so they can be run as part
of a suite without influencing later tests.

Co-Authored-By: Ricardo Rocha <rocha.porto@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I42cccd6c79619bd14c411f43fc179a8f58ceb22e

commit_message:
Permits created guests to reach external networks

Adds MASQUERADE target on FLAT_INTERFACE in order to permit the
created guests to reach external networks.   This patch is needed
in order to avoid manual operations when testing guests connectivity.
In your local.conf file, add ALLOW_EGRESS=True in order to enable it.

Change-Id: Ia555641ed039320ddb9e118b3aa4abeaba58c869
Closes-bug: #1461228

subject: EC Reconstructor: Do not reconstruct existing fragments.
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-06-26 21:50:52.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/reconstructor.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py'], 'message': 'EC Reconstructor: Do not reconstruct existing fragments.

The EC reconstructor needs to verify that the fragment needing to
be reconstructed does not reside in the collection of node responses.
Otherwise, resources will be spent unnecessarily reconstructing
the fragment. Moreover, this could cause a segfault on some backends.

This change adds the necessary verification steps to make sure
that a fragment will only be rebuilt in the case it is missing from
the other fragment archives.

Added some tests to provide coverage for these scenarios.

Change-Id: I91f3d4af52cbc66c9f7ce00726f247b5462e66f9
Closes-Bug: #1452553
'}]
commit_message:
EC Reconstructor: Do not reconstruct existing fragments.

The EC reconstructor needs to verify that the fragment needing to
be reconstructed does not reside in the collection of node responses.
Otherwise, resources will be spent unnecessarily reconstructing
the fragment. Moreover, this could cause a segfault on some backends.

This change adds the necessary verification steps to make sure
that a fragment will only be rebuilt in the case it is missing from
the other fragment archives.

Added some tests to provide coverage for these scenarios.

Change-Id: I91f3d4af52cbc66c9f7ce00726f247b5462e66f9
Closes-Bug: #1452553

commit_message:
SwiftClient object upload beginning with / or "./"

Currently SwiftClient populate response dictionary before
removing "./" or "/" at begining of object name. This patch
fixes that by changing that order.

Closes-bug: #1412425
Change-Id: I80222754caba5d42a468f4677ac539e46682dd31

subject: Added replica_of attribute to test_index_list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-04 00:28:49.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/api/instances.py'], 'message': "Added replica_of attribute to test_index_list

The test_index_list made an assumption that you are running
trove on a clean environment without any previous instances
created. If you happen to have created a replica of an instance
the test would now fail. Adding 'replica_of' to the allowed
attribute will allow this test work with replica instaces.

Change-Id: I80ec0e5f26ea52339082d540f2747e54f08e279b
"}]
commit_message:
Added replica_of attribute to test_index_list

The test_index_list made an assumption that you are running
trove on a clean environment without any previous instances
created. If you happen to have created a replica of an instance
the test would now fail. Adding 'replica_of' to the allowed
attribute will allow this test work with replica instaces.

Change-Id: I80ec0e5f26ea52339082d540f2747e54f08e279b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-07 21:10:27.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Move "bundle install" for puppet-modules-jobs.

  This commit will move where we run "bundle install" for testing the
  beaker upgrade jobs to makes sure "bundle install" is ran with the
  correct Gemfile for its commit.  Then replaces one "bundle install"
  with a "bundle update" so as to set up Gems properly after a new
  commit.

  Without this commit "bundle install" will fail on testing HEAD~1 if
  pinned Gems have changed between commits because of the way "bundle
  install" expects you to run "bundle update" after a Gemfile.lock file
  has been written.

Change-Id: Ibff3f17692721b01b73ed461edd9e06efa3bc3c2
'}]
commit_message:
Move "bundle install" for puppet-modules-jobs.

  This commit will move where we run "bundle install" for testing the
  beaker upgrade jobs to makes sure "bundle install" is ran with the
  correct Gemfile for its commit.  Then replaces one "bundle install"
  with a "bundle update" so as to set up Gems properly after a new
  commit.

  Without this commit "bundle install" will fail on testing HEAD~1 if
  pinned Gems have changed between commits because of the way "bundle
  install" expects you to run "bundle update" after a Gemfile.lock file
  has been written.

Change-Id: Ibff3f17692721b01b73ed461edd9e06efa3bc3c2

commit_message:
Catch errors checking for zuul status

If zuul gives us a bad response, causing requests to throw an error,
sleep a bit and try again instead of dying.

Change-Id: Ifa1cc1524030e89c2ba97899bb90714faf3d05dd

The migration object and model incorrectly mirrored the migration_type
enum from the database schema. Since the affected type (evacuation) has
never been used before this change, we can just make the swap with no
