Related to blueprint robustify-evacuation

Change-Id: If502903fecd315e24c987da6d78b73dcc1305ee3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect enum in Migration object and DB model

The migration object and model incorrectly mirrored the migration_type
enum from the database schema. Since the affected type (evacuation) has
never been used before this change, we can just make the swap with no
version bump.

Related to blueprint robustify-evacuation

Change-Id: If502903fecd315e24c987da6d78b73dcc1305ee3

subject: Handle more errors when updating bugs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-24 18:06:25.000000000', 'files': ['process_bugs.py'], 'message': "Handle more errors when updating bugs

Sometimes the user running the script doesn't have access to a bug that
is marked private and gets a 401 error. Catch *all* errors trying to
update the bug status and treat them all as failures from which we can
continue and then clean up manually.

Change-Id: Ibc37d69259e841ba80bf4d42de5b0b45678fc54b
"}]
commit_message:
Handle more errors when updating bugs

Sometimes the user running the script doesn't have access to a bug that
is marked private and gets a 401 error. Catch *all* errors trying to
update the bug status and treat them all as failures from which we can
continue and then clean up manually.

Change-Id: Ibc37d69259e841ba80bf4d42de5b0b45678fc54b

commit_message:
Updated keystone to use fernet as the default

This change simply enables fernet to be the default token backend
and disables the keystone memcached configuration for token storage.

Change-Id: I1037a7fce567e476f07a5d3c220379d656248160
Related-Bug: #1463569

subject: Close milestones for post-version releases
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-24 18:06:25.000000000', 'files': ['release_postversion.sh', 'README.rst', 'close_milestone.py'], 'message': 'Close milestones for post-version releases

In the process of cleaning up the alpha version handling the call to
close the milestone was removed. The old call was to upload_milestone.py
with --nop to cause the upload to be skipped. Rather than restoring it
directly, create a new script that only closes the milestone and use
that.

Change-Id: Idf7bef35e290d2888800d33aba17ca744c90bfc9
'}]
commit_message:
Close milestones for post-version releases

In the process of cleaning up the alpha version handling the call to
close the milestone was removed. The old call was to upload_milestone.py
with --nop to cause the upload to be skipped. Rather than restoring it
directly, create a new script that only closes the milestone and use
that.

Change-Id: Idf7bef35e290d2888800d33aba17ca744c90bfc9

commit_message:
get-me-a-network: Really get a network

This modifies the approved spec around "Get-Me-A-Network" to include
wording to indicate we will actually implement auto-creation of
resources in Neutron when nova boots a VM.

subject: Adds Hyper-V Shielded VMs spec
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 3185, 'name': 'Alessandro Pilotti', 'email': 'apilotti@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'alexpilotti'}, {'_account_id': 8213, 'name': 'Claudiu Belu', 'email': 'claudiu.belu@canonical.com', 'username': 'claudiub'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-06-24 23:05:39.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/hyper-v-shielded-vms.rst'], 'message': 'Adds Hyper-V Shielded VMs spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-shielded-vms

If the administrator of a hypervisor host is compromised, all of the
existent virtual machine data can be read, which is highly undesirable.

Windows / Hyper-V Server Technical Preview introduced the concept of
shielded VMs, offering the users an environment where the protection
of the virtual machine data is enhanced against threats like malware,
compromised storage, network and even host administrators.

Change-Id: I4b242faeb6c94285df37133828ca4c0231e64a3b
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-shielded-vms
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V Shielded VMs spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-shielded-vms

If the administrator of a hypervisor host is compromised, all of the
existent virtual machine data can be read, which is highly undesirable.

Windows / Hyper-V Server Technical Preview introduced the concept of
shielded VMs, offering the users an environment where the protection
of the virtual machine data is enhanced against threats like malware,
compromised storage, network and even host administrators.

Change-Id: I4b242faeb6c94285df37133828ca4c0231e64a3b
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-shielded-vms

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 7806, 'name': 'Sushil Kumar', 'email': 'skm.net@gmail.com', 'username': 'sushilkm'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 14576, 'name': 'Petr Malik', 'email': 'pmalik@tesora.com', 'username': 'pmalik'}, {'_account_id': 14823, 'name': 'Pete MacKinnon', 'email': 'pmackinn@redhat.com', 'username': 'pmackinn'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-30 12:59:05.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/__init__.py', 'trove/tests/util/server_connection.py'], 'message': 'Provide option to read SSH credentials from test env

Currently the SSH user and private key is assumed to be taken
from the local account (e.g., /home/ubuntu/.ssh). This change
proposes to add 2 environment variables so that a tox test of
Trove can use an arbitrary SSH user and key file for testing.
Obviously, this assumes that the test setup has already
installed those credentials in the image under test.

Change-Id: Ibc83cb7fcd291a13706550965fe2dd1d5ca3504e
Closes-Bug: 1469775
'}]
commit_message:
Provide option to read SSH credentials from test env

Currently the SSH user and private key is assumed to be taken
from the local account (e.g., /home/ubuntu/.ssh). This change
proposes to add 2 environment variables so that a tox test of
Trove can use an arbitrary SSH user and key file for testing.
Obviously, this assumes that the test setup has already
installed those credentials in the image under test.

Change-Id: Ibc83cb7fcd291a13706550965fe2dd1d5ca3504e
Closes-Bug: 1469775

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-07 16:52:33.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml', 'reference/tags/index.rst', 'reference/tags/integrated-release.rst'], 'message': 'Remove the 'integrated-release' tag

The 'integrated-release' tag was a legacy tag to ensure the
transition between the "Integrated Release" project model and
the "Big Tent with Tags" project model.

We are far enough into the transition now that we can remove
the legacy tag and look forward.

Notes:
- "Integrated" was mentioned in two project team mission statements
  (Horizon and Release Cycle Management), which means this change
  will require their respective PTLs approvals
- Information about integrated release (in particular the "since"
  cycle) is not lost and can easily be retrieved using the
  april-2015-elections tag

Change-Id: I20c662c812f3a1952f21a4ae1cb677a8ae3db488
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the 'integrated-release' tag

The 'integrated-release' tag was a legacy tag to ensure the
transition between the "Integrated Release" project model and
the "Big Tent with Tags" project model.

We are far enough into the transition now that we can remove
the legacy tag and look forward.

Notes:
- "Integrated" was mentioned in two project team mission statements
  (Horizon and Release Cycle Management), which means this change
  will require their respective PTLs approvals
- Information about integrated release (in particular the "since"
  cycle) is not lost and can easily be retrieved using the
  april-2015-elections tag

Change-Id: I20c662c812f3a1952f21a4ae1cb677a8ae3db488

This patch updates the spec_helper_acceptance.rb file to use the common
module install script and Puppetfile from the new
openstack/puppet-openstack-integration repo. This will allow us to take
advantage of Zuul's Depends-On feature so that we can test changes
across multiple related modules. This is based on idea 1 from this

This will probably be abstracted out into a separate function or
eventually a separate gem so that it can be more easily shared across

commit_message:
Use module install script for acceptance tests

This patch updates the spec_helper_acceptance.rb file to use the common
module install script and Puppetfile from the new
openstack/puppet-openstack-integration repo. This will allow us to take
advantage of Zuul's Depends-On feature so that we can test changes
across multiple related modules. This is based on idea 1 from this
brainstorming session[1].

This will probably be abstracted out into a separate function or
eventually a separate gem so that it can be more easily shared across
the OpenStack modules and the Infra modules.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/puppet-git-dependencies

Change-Id: Ia47b609f1d05f5f9000dd977b9ded35afbe7e3f4
Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <jeblair@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Spencer Krum <spencer.krum@hp.com>

commit_message:
Add 55572 to the reserved ports list for murano

This change adds 55572 to the reserved ports list for murano. Without
this change, some deployments fail occastionally when port 55572 is in
use.

Change-Id: If62504a5b3b7110d35278fe3654cdbb35dbbe194
Closes-Bug: 1467024

commit_message:
Fix deletion action failure handling

If during handling action some exception occurs, it cause
traceback in logs. It happens because of
wrong formatting in log.warning. This patch resolves this issue.

Change-Id: I039fde6e6c8625b8dd4fd0ca40224c1f3c60c26c
Closes-bug: 1470826

commit_message:
Apply tc-approved-release tag

The tc-approved-release tag was defined but never applied.
Following the definition, it is initially applied to all
formerly "integrated-release" members.

neutron-fwass was left out since the FWaaS API is experimental
until consensus has been reached on the Neutron team that it is
stable:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ReleaseNotes/Kilo#Known_Issues_5

Change-Id: I6ffe2cd9969518c72479ea6c9950d9e36d39f80d

commit_message:
Update VIP to subnet id to match neutron-lbaas API

Modify the data_models and models to include subnet_id
Add alembic migration to modify the vip table for subnet_id
Update allowed address pairs methods to use subnet_id to retrieve network_id
Update network and database tasks
Update tests accordingly

Change-Id: Ie2876ce8c93bfb5cce8ee8606028ec91fb6c1db4

commit_message:
Add support for full images.

This adds support for booting images that contain the kernel and ramdisk etc.
in them.  This is required to allow us to boot fedora-atomic (or other OSes) to
use with containerized openstack services.

Change-Id: I7af59459074a39a55cf3c662102c7270963958e6

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-07-07 11:24:34.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/ilo/test_common.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/common.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/deploy.py', 'doc/source/drivers/ilo.rst', 'driver-requirements.txt', 'ironic/tests/drivers/ilo/test_deploy.py'], 'message': "Clear ilo_boot_iso before deploy for glance images

This commit clears instance_info['ilo_boot_iso']
in iscsi_ilo driver for glance images before beginning
deploy.  This will make sure that in rebuild event with
glance images, we don't end up using previously generated
(or used) boot ISOs.

It also ejects any virtual media devices connected to make
sure that deploy images can be connected later on during
deploy.  The proliantutils version is updated to 2.1.1,
which makes sure that we silently return on
ilo_client.eject_vmedia_device() when virtual media is not
connected (instead of raising an exception).

Change-Id: I68fcfc2b62cb58dd1c16f312c3a6a2ebd383c170
Closes-Bug: 1466729
"}]
commit_message:
Clear ilo_boot_iso before deploy for glance images

This commit clears instance_info['ilo_boot_iso']
in iscsi_ilo driver for glance images before beginning
deploy.  This will make sure that in rebuild event with
glance images, we don't end up using previously generated
(or used) boot ISOs.

It also ejects any virtual media devices connected to make
sure that deploy images can be connected later on during
deploy.  The proliantutils version is updated to 2.1.1,
which makes sure that we silently return on
ilo_client.eject_vmedia_device() when virtual media is not
connected (instead of raising an exception).

Change-Id: I68fcfc2b62cb58dd1c16f312c3a6a2ebd383c170
Closes-Bug: 1466729

Keystone invalidates every token for a user after revoking one group role
within one project.

This patch replaces 'invalidate user's everything' logic with revocation by
grant via notifications for delete_grant assignment operation.

Change-Id: I7af205757232f19724b1bf124399d4e206aa2003

commit_message:
Group role revocation invalidates all user tokens

Keystone invalidates every token for a user after revoking one group role
within one project.

This patch replaces 'invalidate user's everything' logic with revocation by
grant via notifications for delete_grant assignment operation.

Change-Id: I7af205757232f19724b1bf124399d4e206aa2003
Closes-Bug: #1402760
Closes-Bug: #1401926

commit_message:
Install etc/octavia/* files

Instead of enforcing every packager or deployment tool to copy the files
into proper locations, install them as part of usual setuptools
installation process. It's the same as other services do, f.e. neutron.

Change-Id: Ib36dc0b19cf902d8251ab910f84513c57ca324f4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-07 13:05:57.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/api/quickstart/certificates.rst'], 'message': "Fix JSON structure example for stored-key orders

The JSON dict that's used for the meta that's given to the server to
make a stored-key typed certificate order should be 'container_ref'
and not 'source_container_ref'. This confusion might have been
introduced since the client actually refers to that as the former
('source_container_ref'), even though the actual JSON that is sent to
the server is different.

Change-Id: Icb8d2052c9e8aee72ce48709b3ee40bcc188a85b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix JSON structure example for stored-key orders

The JSON dict that's used for the meta that's given to the server to
make a stored-key typed certificate order should be 'container_ref'
and not 'source_container_ref'. This confusion might have been
introduced since the client actually refers to that as the former
('source_container_ref'), even though the actual JSON that is sent to
the server is different.

Change-Id: Icb8d2052c9e8aee72ce48709b3ee40bcc188a85b

commit_message:
Initial oslo.versionedobjects conversion

Trivial steps to start using oslo.versionedobjects in Ironic, this patch
simply replace the dict compat class with the one in the library and
make the oslo.versionedobjects library a requirement.

Partial-Bug: #1461239
Change-Id: If4d2583f0d107d817539b60341861e3c2a29b6c1

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-07 05:19:15.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/controller/worker/tasks/cert_task.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I749f43bd6dc15717154475cc1a776ffd6164b7fa
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I749f43bd6dc15717154475cc1a776ffd6164b7fa

commit_message:
Allow preexec_fn method for processutils.execute

If the user specifies preexec_fn, we should call that in
our existing _subprocess_setup. On windows, we silently
drop this preexec_fn as subprocess.Popen raises a ValueError
if we do pass it in.

Change-Id: I0176c66fa2de001aa14f0d928d06fd894de55511

subject: Allow preexec_fn method for processutils.execute

Change-Id: I0176c66fa2de001aa14f0d928d06fd894de55511

commit_message:
Allow preexec_fn method for processutils.execute

If the user specifies preexec_fn, we should call that in
our existing _subprocess_setup. On windows, we silently
drop this preexec_fn as subprocess.Popen raises a ValueError
if we do pass it in.

Change-Id: I0176c66fa2de001aa14f0d928d06fd894de55511

commit_message:
Add set_management_url to cinderclient.client

set_management_url was used in authenticate method but wasn't defined
in the HTTPClient. This commit implements missing method and adds
regression unit tests.

Change-Id: I605a5d1bcf6cc2dc5720820d8a8122dd17089ffa
Closes-Bug: 1418580

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-03 06:58:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/disk/test_api.py', 'nova/virt/disk/api.py'], 'message': 'virt: Fix AttributeError for raw image format

Nova compute raises AttributeError on creating a new instance with raw
image format leading instance to go in to error state. This bug is
introduced by commit I34e2f29e1f068636036226a7745d88640f724d93 which
added image.file in disk api instead of image.path.

Changed image.file to image.path to fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: 1470356
Change-Id: I4a12263a992eaf8abf2e90089591051d5aa57585
'}]
commit_message:
virt: Fix AttributeError for raw image format

Nova compute raises AttributeError on creating a new instance with raw
image format leading instance to go in to error state. This bug is
introduced by commit I34e2f29e1f068636036226a7745d88640f724d93 which
added image.file in disk api instead of image.path.

Changed image.file to image.path to fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: 1470356
Change-Id: I4a12263a992eaf8abf2e90089591051d5aa57585

commit_message:
add functional tests for identity v3

To make test cases more clearly, split test_identity.py
into test_user.py, test_role, etc. Add more test cases for
user, role, etc. Furthermore, to make functional tests run
repeatedly without raising duplicated error, clean up
resources before exiting each test case.

Change-Id: I1541943ad0b8d4d8d1e72822c159fda243b3d1d7
Implements: blueprint identity-functional-tests

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-07 02:47:22.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/ironic-install/tasks/create_tftpboot.yml'], 'message': 'Fix check for >= Ubuntu 14.10

In the ironic-install role, we currently only check the
ansible_distribution_version to determine where to source pxelinux.0,
but the check is clearly Ubuntu-specific. The check needs to be modified

Change-Id: I553f1c3cfe70afa2f8d1c6fbf73cb7cab375b4fa

commit_message:
Fix check for >= Ubuntu 14.10

In the ironic-install role, we currently only check the
ansible_distribution_version to determine where to source pxelinux.0,
but the check is clearly Ubuntu-specific. The check needs to be modified
to work correctly on other distros.

Change-Id: I553f1c3cfe70afa2f8d1c6fbf73cb7cab375b4fa
Closes-Bug: #1471973

subject: Move Cinder-volumes to "on metal"
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-25 11:08:40.000000000', 'files': ['etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/cinder.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.example'], 'message': 'Move Cinder-volumes to "on metal"

Cinder-volumes is tightly coupled to the storage host and doesn't
gain from the benefits of containerization. This patch moves the default
location for cinder-scheduler into it's own container on the
"storage-infra_hosts", and the default location for cinder-volumes to be
"on metal" in the openstack_environment cinder.yml file.

Added documentation to suggest that you may want to remove "is_metal:
true" from cinder-volumes service when not using lvm.

Change-Id: I1879b1aa6dbe69a5a7e769a43b849441a38feeb8
Closes-Bug: #1433240
(cherry picked from commit 91bd96b9e1f59a650bfb8db5f414b3aae7bdea07)
'}]
commit_message:
Move Cinder-volumes to "on metal"

Cinder-volumes is tightly coupled to the storage host and doesn't
gain from the benefits of containerization. This patch moves the default
location for cinder-scheduler into it's own container on the
"storage-infra_hosts", and the default location for cinder-volumes to be
"on metal" in the openstack_environment cinder.yml file.

Added documentation to suggest that you may want to remove "is_metal:
true" from cinder-volumes service when not using lvm.

Change-Id: I1879b1aa6dbe69a5a7e769a43b849441a38feeb8
Closes-Bug: #1433240
(cherry picked from commit 91bd96b9e1f59a650bfb8db5f414b3aae7bdea07)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 23:58:28.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'Search for service by type

When you get or create service it first checks to see if an existing
service matching these parameters exists. The definition of existing is
having a service with the same name, however name is not a unique field.
Sahara for example creates two services, one with data-processing, one
with data_processing with the same sahara name.

Search for existing services by service type, not by service name.

Change-Id: I6148e2254aa3968039b0e7c178e7cabc53b6be68
'}]
commit_message:
Search for service by type

When you get or create service it first checks to see if an existing
service matching these parameters exists. The definition of existing is
having a service with the same name, however name is not a unique field.
Sahara for example creates two services, one with data-processing, one
with data_processing with the same sahara name.

Search for existing services by service type, not by service name.

Change-Id: I6148e2254aa3968039b0e7c178e7cabc53b6be68

commit_message:
Python 3: do not index dict_keys objects

This cannot be done in Python 3, where dict.keys() returns an iterator. We need
to cast the result of dict.keys() to a list first.

Change-Id: I28986aefb720b4513e3eee9ba0909f79d1dc9695
Blueprint: neutron-python3

commit_message:
Allow customization of included classes via hieradata

Allows inclusion of additional arbitrary puppet classes by the
manifests if defined in the *_classes hieradata.

Example: to specify the Nova RAM allocation ratio there is a
param in nova::scheduler::filter but we do not include it
by default; if needed one can use:

  nova::scheduler::filter::ram_allocation_ratio: 1.8
  controller_classes:
    - nova::scheduler::filter

Change-Id: I61d64d2498bed5c49376dee917d106598392db51

commit_message:
Spec for sending polled meters to notification agent

As requested, this is a spec that describes adjusting the polling
agents such that they no longer perform transformations or other
sink-side handling described by pipeline.yaml but instead merely
push the results of their polling to the notification agent.

blueprint pollsters-no-transform

Change-Id: I61f6c17f2e561a5fa738f149a6b1f4d6f5bd5ea2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-01 23:58:06.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/mongodb/api.py'], 'message': 'Support nics and AZ for MongoDB clusters

A previous commit [1] added the infrastructure to support Neutron network
and availability zone selection for instances in clusters. That commit also
implemented this support for Vertica. This commit extends that work to
support the nics and az parameters for MongoDB.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/179443

Closes-bug: 1447350

Change-Id: I6828c79236c36a434eeb70210dcb85738e432830

commit_message:
Support nics and AZ for MongoDB clusters

A previous commit [1] added the infrastructure to support Neutron network
and availability zone selection for instances in clusters. That commit also
implemented this support for Vertica. This commit extends that work to
support the nics and az parameters for MongoDB.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/179443

Closes-bug: 1447350

Setting all API versions to be the same is totally unrealistic.
As such it's confusing to have code that allows something that's

Change-Id: Ie7cab8ec60b17262183e034d01bb648d28bb7ad1

commit_message:
Don't allow users to set all API versions the same

Setting all API versions to be the same is totally unrealistic.
As such it's confusing to have code that allows something that's
totally unrealistic. Let's remove things that will never ever
happen.

Change-Id: Ie7cab8ec60b17262183e034d01bb648d28bb7ad1

commit_message:
Remove ability to get global user roles.

The Keystone server does not support getting a users roles without a
tenant. This functionality isn't implemented and isn't going to be
implemented according to bug report (see bug 1418015 and bug 933565).
This change reflects those changes.

Change-Id: Iafd88674740324a84091fefae37b507bdb93d756
Related-Bug: 933565
Related-Bug: 1418015

commit_message:
Update DVR agent to use get_vifs_by_id

The new get_vifs_by_id function retrieves all of the VIFs
for a port iteration at once to eliminate unnecessary multiple
calls to OVSDB.

Change-Id: If18557faead836121bfa3b4e6efccd0318ce72d3
Related-Bug: #1460233

subject: Fix tox environment for package version problems
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-07 15:44:03.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'setup.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix tox environment for package version problems

This is an attempt to fix package version problem caused by Routes. In
the gobal requirements (at the moment), we have to use version 1.13 of
the Routes package. However, that version is not py34 friendly. This
patch adds a separate testenv and a separate requirements-py3.txt file
to deal with this.

Change-Id: Id751f3303b546ac066f65c16385232dcc10bd790
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tox environment for package version problems

This is an attempt to fix package version problem caused by Routes. In
the gobal requirements (at the moment), we have to use version 1.13 of
the Routes package. However, that version is not py34 friendly. This
patch adds a separate testenv and a separate requirements-py3.txt file
to deal with this.

Change-Id: Id751f3303b546ac066f65c16385232dcc10bd790

commit_message:
Upgrade git to 1.8 for puppet-apply job

Our Centos6 job is suffering from performance issue with git. By
upgrading to version 1.8 we dramatically decrease our build times.

Change-Id: Ie1dd2068baee0076ccb88372e68177f39738fe4e
Closes-Bug: #1468480
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

When generate JUnit report, add <failure/> tag to failed test case.
Criterion and detail from sla is also added as type and message with failure tag.

subject: Set default inventory file for inventory-manage.py
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-07 10:38:02.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/inventory-manage.py'], 'message': "Set default inventory file for inventory-manage.py

The script inventory-manage.py takes a file argument. The default name
for this file, in the project, is openstack_inventory.json. Not only is
it the default but the rest of the project assumes that it will be that
name.

This commit sets the default argument for the file parameter to this
assumed file name - 'openstack_inventory.json'.

Change-Id: I635122d22bb0467aad21f48dccda1bc0444518c1
Closes-bug: #1454324"}]
commit_message:
Set default inventory file for inventory-manage.py

The script inventory-manage.py takes a file argument. The default name
for this file, in the project, is openstack_inventory.json. Not only is
it the default but the rest of the project assumes that it will be that
name.

This commit sets the default argument for the file parameter to this
assumed file name - 'openstack_inventory.json'.

Change-Id: I635122d22bb0467aad21f48dccda1bc0444518c1
Closes-bug: #1454324

commit_message:
Add SSL-related fields to settings page

Added fields about TLS for public OpenStack endpoints
divided by two groups - for Horizon and for other
services. Fields allow you to select services for which
you want to use SSL and give you opportunity to either
use self-signed keypair for these services (will
be generated after deploy started) or upload your own
certificate and key in format which HAProxy will
understand.

Change-Id: Ie6be3d2ed4e1864e5898d1c7d12ec761af01a041
Implements: blueprint ssl-endpoints

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-07-03 07:50:54.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/servicegroup-api-control-plane.rst'], 'message': "Servicegroup foundational refactoring for Control Plane

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data can
be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), servicegroup API layer. Having different
interfaces to manipulate the source of truth can lead to severe
data inconsistency for something as useful as stored in nova.services.
The proposal is to follow a common path, while interacting with services
data, for all the three interfaces mentioned above. This common path will
go through the servicegroup layer, who's primary purpose is to manage
and check for service liveliness. Doing so will help to overcome the
tight coupling between nova and services database and also have a
consistent view of services data, service liveliness, etc.

Change-Id: I6d017d34e6d07ae6fb45b22780c5bd26e3ead23b
Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane
"}]
commit_message:
Servicegroup foundational refactoring for Control Plane

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data can
be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), servicegroup API layer. Having different
interfaces to manipulate the source of truth can lead to severe
data inconsistency for something as useful as stored in nova.services.
The proposal is to follow a common path, while interacting with services
data, for all the three interfaces mentioned above. This common path will
go through the servicegroup layer, who's primary purpose is to manage
and check for service liveliness. Doing so will help to overcome the
tight coupling between nova and services database and also have a
consistent view of services data, service liveliness, etc.

Change-Id: I6d017d34e6d07ae6fb45b22780c5bd26e3ead23b
Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane

commit_message:
[Nailgun] Plugin Sync API

Current commit provide implementation of API call for plugin
metadata synchronization from config files into DB

* New PluginSync handler, validator and new url
* New plugin wrapper for 3.0.0 plugin version with
  sync metadata method

Change-Id: I223ec14afbfa0852f231ad8dd2c5289758997b0d
Implements: blueprint role-as-a-plugin

commit_message:
Add libvirt package dependency to install step

We try to edit /etc/libvirt/libvirtd.conf in place, but this will
fail if the correct packages are missing. Add the right packages to
this step.

Change-Id: I850eb885ed7a70066ca8924667d705cf1496ba9d

commit_message:
Add new version of builder class

Add builder class for 3.0.0 version. New builder works with rpm specs
where pre/post hooks are described.

Now each bilder class can process different templates for rpm specs and
ubuntu repos releases. To make that happen version_mapping module was
modified.

Tests updated

DocImpact: Describe spec scripts in Fuel Plugin wiki

Change-Id: I10f07cfb9569ccf8c9cc0639646678cbaabd6f7f
Closes-Bug: #1462976
Partial-Blueprint: detach-components-from-controllers

commit_message:
Introduce Block Storage / Cinder chapter

Previously there were sporadic references to Block
storage within the guide, but no dedicated home to
add specific sections about Cinder.

This adds a general introduction chapter to cover
cinder which is expected to be expanded in the
near term.

Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13948, 'name': 'Bartłomiej Piotrowski', 'email': 'bpiotrowski@mirantis.com', 'username': 'bpiotrowski'}, {'_account_id': 14168, 'name': 'Alexandr Nevenchannyy', 'email': 'anevenchannyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'anevenchannyy'}, {'_account_id': 14421, 'name': 'Alexey Khivin', 'email': 'akhivin@gmail.com', 'username': 'akhivin'}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-07 10:13:50.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Fix chowning for rabbit OCF

W/o this fix, the list of file names not
accessible by rabbitmq user will be treated
as multiple arguments to the if command causing
it to throw the "too many arguments" error and
the chown command to be skipped.

This is the problem as it might prevent the rabbitmq
server from starting because of a bad files ownership.

The solution is to pass the list of files as a single
argument "${foo}".

Closes-bug: #1472175

Change-Id: I1d00ec3f31cd0f023bd58a4e11e5b31659977229
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix chowning for rabbit OCF

W/o this fix, the list of file names not
accessible by rabbitmq user will be treated
as multiple arguments to the if command causing
it to throw the "too many arguments" error and
the chown command to be skipped.

This is the problem as it might prevent the rabbitmq
server from starting because of a bad files ownership.

The solution is to pass the list of files as a single
argument "${foo}".

Closes-bug: #1472175

Change-Id: I1d00ec3f31cd0f023bd58a4e11e5b31659977229
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Backport logrotate changes from 6.1

* use tabooext to ensure no overlap between Fuel's cron job and the
  system one
* run logrotate twice an hour
* merge weekly and daily configuration files
* rotate logs basing on two criteria: age and size
* use dateformat to make rotated logs' filename more readable
* enable delayed compression to avoid race condition between
  fuel-logrotate and regular logrotate
* combine CentOS and Ubuntu logrotate wrappers to a single file

Related-Bug: 1382515
Related-Bug: 1450039
Related-Bug: 1461400
Closes-Bug:  1472179
Change-Id: I58caf3c93943af818a03e07d534ff8c42a63d2cb

commit_message:
Adapt synced openstacklib module

  * All this changes are temporary, they should be removed when
    mysql module is updated
  * add mysql_module parameter to provide backward compatibility
    for mysql < 2.2
  * disable rspec tests for openstacklib
  * bind default value of mysql_module to '0.3' to avoid
    changes in upstream modules
  * added noop tests for mysql databases

It should fail noop tests and it's OK. It will start passing noop
tests for Openstacklib::Db::Mysql::Host_access only when we sync
all modules that use it with upstream.

Partially Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

Change-Id: I5a31ecac08d30ff82abfe678b6eaad00849c317a

commit_message:
Introduce the AFTER_READ callback for ports and networks

This callback can be used by extensions and service plugins to extend
port and network information on read time, without the need of plugin
mixins.

Partially-implements: blueprint quantum-qos-api
Change-Id: Ifc92c19a69d28784c030d605c2eb161c2ba4b3f5

It is possible to initialize ImageCache with specific image service
class that will be downloading images. When there was only one type
of image links supported - links from glance, it was OK, but now http
and file links are also supported, so if ImageCache will be
initialized with specific image service (e.g. glance), it will not be
able to download other supported types of images. This should not be
allowed.

image_service argument in common.images.fetch is removed for the same
reason. As a consequence of that, out-of-tree image services should
be added to common.image_service.get_image_service method so that
they can be used properly by common.images.fetch.

Closes-bug: #1468727

Change-Id: I428daa4ddf6f88ef222e8b26650d0ad461a67eec
'}]
commit_message:
Image service should not be set in ImageCache constructor

It is possible to initialize ImageCache with specific image service
class that will be downloading images. When there was only one type
of image links supported - links from glance, it was OK, but now http
and file links are also supported, so if ImageCache will be
initialized with specific image service (e.g. glance), it will not be
able to download other supported types of images. This should not be
allowed.

image_service argument in common.images.fetch is removed for the same
reason. As a consequence of that, out-of-tree image services should
be added to common.image_service.get_image_service method so that
they can be used properly by common.images.fetch.

Closes-bug: #1468727

Change-Id: I428daa4ddf6f88ef222e8b26650d0ad461a67eec

commit_message:
corrected the wrong url in admin instance detail

In admin instance detail page, the url for attached volume
pointing to volume detail in project panel.

This behavior is wrong, it should be link to admin panel only.

This patch corrected the url to point to the admin panel volume detail.

Change-Id: I76419f1236304211602fa98f3885d8a2a05b6468
Closes-Bug: #1470821

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-24 19:43:46.000000000', 'files': ['tools/config/generate_sample.sh', 'tools/config/oslo.config.generator.rc'], 'message': 'Fix library includes for config generator

Noticed today while working on fixing issues
with the config generator that oslo_policy
had been added in the wrong location for
pulling the config options in to the config
generator.

This fix moves the items that had been put in
oslo.config.generator.rc but were missing in generate_sample.sh
over to the appropriate location.  I also removed the option for
importing additional libraries in oslo.config.generator.rc
given that it will not work.

I am still working on a longer term solution, but
we really should get this fixed so we can generate sample
config files again.

Change-Id: I2c14c1acc49d68305dca5a3dedc686ab07ed2088
'}]
commit_message:
Fix library includes for config generator

Noticed today while working on fixing issues
with the config generator that oslo_policy
had been added in the wrong location for
pulling the config options in to the config
generator.

This fix moves the items that had been put in
oslo.config.generator.rc but were missing in generate_sample.sh
over to the appropriate location.  I also removed the option for
importing additional libraries in oslo.config.generator.rc
given that it will not work.

I am still working on a longer term solution, but
we really should get this fixed so we can generate sample
config files again.

Change-Id: I2c14c1acc49d68305dca5a3dedc686ab07ed2088

This patch adds an optional flag that can be used to

Change-Id: Ic21de0615ea0ef304843c55cc5abe43cb1771169
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for dhclient_args

This patch adds an optional flag that can be used to
pass in args for dhclient when using DHCP.

This use case for this is to be able to control which
DHCP options dhclient listens for and we can thus
disable specific options (like routing) for some
network configurations.

Change-Id: Ic21de0615ea0ef304843c55cc5abe43cb1771169

commit_message:
API changes for Reseller

Documents the API spec changes for the Reseller implementation.

* Create the ``is_domain`` flag for projects
* Add the new behavior on requesting project scoped tokens using
  the project name
* Add the ``is_domain`` attribute in project scoped tokens response

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte Sousa <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Henrique Truta <henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

bp reseller
bp add-isdomain-to-token

Change-Id: I0a3db962d450e5a6e886dea64016dbee7187b0fc

commit_message:
Run qemu-img as root when examining disk

This code is called to examine the size of a qcow2 image.

This fails when the disk is attached to the VM because
the volume file it isn't readable by the Nova user.  Run
qemu-img as root so the command can fetch the needed
information.

Closes-Bug: #1416132

Change-Id: I67ba36745b916b5b09e6200016505e541832cdd3

Sometimes data size in network packets should be lower than
(1500-28) bytes because additional devices, that are used in virtual
network, increase size of the packets so the desired size of the
packet doesn't match actual MTU size allowed for the communication

commit_message:
Take another try to ping instance respecting new MTU size

Sometimes data size in network packets should be lower than
(1500-28) bytes because additional devices, that are used in virtual
network, increase size of the packets so the desired size of the
packet doesn't match actual MTU size allowed for the communication
channel.

Change-Id: I3ba943cd140cde69e4e66062d8690ef5e8b7e7aa
Closes-Bug:#1471317

Due to a few issue that exist between keystone v3 and v2.0 the endpoint

see the endpoint.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1470635

Partially-Implements: blueprint ansible-service

commit_message:
Have bootstrap script create the initial endpoint

Due to a few issue that exist between keystone v3 and v2.0 the endpoint
needs to be created as v2.0. If it is created as v3, v2.0 queries will not
see the endpoint.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1470635

Change-Id: Ie7ff88b8cbb23b3ca149cb6e8d5a18a427d22038
Partially-Implements: blueprint ansible-service

This change adds an "interface" map to the API for job creation, such that
the operator registering a job can define a unified, human-readable way to
pass in all arguments, parameters, and configurations that the execution
of that job may require or accept. This will allow platform-agnostic
wizarding at the job execution phase and allows users to document use of
their own jobs once in a persistent, standardized format.

Change-Id: I59b9b679a650361ddcd30975891496fdfbabb93c
Partially Implements: blueprint unified-job-interface-map
'}]
commit_message:
[EDP] Unified Map to Define Job Interface

This change adds an "interface" map to the API for job creation, such that
the operator registering a job can define a unified, human-readable way to
pass in all arguments, parameters, and configurations that the execution
of that job may require or accept. This will allow platform-agnostic
wizarding at the job execution phase and allows users to document use of
their own jobs once in a persistent, standardized format.

Change-Id: I59b9b679a650361ddcd30975891496fdfbabb93c
Partially Implements: blueprint unified-job-interface-map

commit_message:
Modify run_tests.sh to support PostgreSQL

Modify run_tests.sh to run unit tests with PostgreSQL. Fix a number of
connection pool and deadlock related issues in the unit tests. Fix DB
clean up routine to remove records in the correct context and order.

subject: Bump check-ironic-inspector-dsvm-nv timeout to usual 2 hours
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-02 14:15:24.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'message': "Bump check-ironic-inspector-dsvm-nv timeout to usual 2 hours

It's an insane amount of time for such a simple job, and under normal
conditions it does not take more than 30 minutes. However, we are
suffering from https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2000310
and this change may reduce failure rate.

Change-Id: Ia0e1de69d99bf9321c942ee5af08a930da63538c
"}]
commit_message:
Bump check-ironic-inspector-dsvm-nv timeout to usual 2 hours

It's an insane amount of time for such a simple job, and under normal
conditions it does not take more than 30 minutes. However, we are
suffering from https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2000310
and this change may reduce failure rate.

Change-Id: Ia0e1de69d99bf9321c942ee5af08a930da63538c

subject: Ensure test_find_zone_imports waits for all imports
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-03 16:03:49.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/test_central/test_service.py'], 'message': 'Ensure test_find_zone_imports waits for all imports

test_find_zone_imports was only waiting for a single zone
import to complete, rather than both of the imports created
during the tests to complete. This resulted in occasional
failures in the gate if the second import finished before
the first.

Change-Id: Iad2b518b3e4bccded305de2ee3e7fdbbf82095f8
Closes-Bug: 1470854
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure test_find_zone_imports waits for all imports

test_find_zone_imports was only waiting for a single zone
import to complete, rather than both of the imports created
during the tests to complete. This resulted in occasional
failures in the gate if the second import finished before
the first.

Change-Id: Iad2b518b3e4bccded305de2ee3e7fdbbf82095f8
Closes-Bug: 1470854

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8907, 'name': 'Dmitry Shulyak', 'email': 'dshulyak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dshulyak'}, {'_account_id': 8954, 'name': 'Lukasz Oles', 'email': 'loles@mirantis.com', 'username': 'loles'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 12200, 'name': 'Sebastian Kalinowski', 'email': 'sebastian@kalinowski.eu', 'username': 'prmtl'}, {'_account_id': 14543, 'name': 'Maciej Kwiek', 'email': 'mkwiek@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mkwiek'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-06 13:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/deployment_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_migration_volume_manager_extension_001_add_volumes_table.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_provisioning_serializer.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_cluster_changes_handler.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/db/migration/__init__.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_volume_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/models/__init__.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/fuel_7_0.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/consts.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/alembic_migrations/migrations/versions/001_add_volumes_table.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/extension.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_node_disks.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/handlers/disks.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_migration_fuel_7_0.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_extensions.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/provisioning_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/models/node_volumes.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/db/sqlalchemy/models/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer.py'], 'message': "Move volumes data from the core into volume manager extension

Migration the data from core into an extension is not
a trivial problem, ideally extension should know nothing
about core's fields in the database and vice versa.

We had several options:
1. move data migration into an extension, it's a bad
   option, because in migration we should drop
   node.attributes.volumes column, it's a very bad
   thing to do, because only core's migrations should
   be responsible for managing of core's db schema
2. implement everything in the core, cannot be implemented
   for the same reasons as for 1st option, in this
   case we should run extension's db migration in
   order to create required fields and then
   in core migration hardcode table's name to migrate
   the data
3. use shared table, in this case core's responsibility
   is to just put all of the data from core's models
   into predefined table and drop node.attributes.volumes column,
   extension migration script's responsibility is to check
   if in predefined table there are data for this specific
   extension, and retrieve these data if there are any

We've decided to use shared table (3rd option) because it's
better option then two others.

Another change is we are not going to use extension version
as a prefix for extension tables. As result we will
not have two extension with the same name, but different
version installed at the same time. Using version in
table names dramatically increase complexity of extension
update.

Implements blueprint: volume-manager-refactoring
Change-Id: I6f03a535edab18e6d9e53a47fc4abdd381a3495f
"}]
commit_message:
Move volumes data from the core into volume manager extension

Migration the data from core into an extension is not
a trivial problem, ideally extension should know nothing
about core's fields in the database and vice versa.

We had several options:
1. move data migration into an extension, it's a bad
   option, because in migration we should drop
   node.attributes.volumes column, it's a very bad
   thing to do, because only core's migrations should
   be responsible for managing of core's db schema
2. implement everything in the core, cannot be implemented
   for the same reasons as for 1st option, in this
   case we should run extension's db migration in
   order to create required fields and then
   in core migration hardcode table's name to migrate
   the data
3. use shared table, in this case core's responsibility
   is to just put all of the data from core's models
   into predefined table and drop node.attributes.volumes column,
   extension migration script's responsibility is to check
   if in predefined table there are data for this specific
   extension, and retrieve these data if there are any

We've decided to use shared table (3rd option) because it's
better option then two others.

Another change is we are not going to use extension version
as a prefix for extension tables. As result we will
not have two extension with the same name, but different
version installed at the same time. Using version in
table names dramatically increase complexity of extension
update.

Implements blueprint: volume-manager-refactoring
Change-Id: I6f03a535edab18e6d9e53a47fc4abdd381a3495f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-07 10:00:06.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': 'FA: oslo.serialization -> oslo_serialization

The issue is that oslo log module tries to
import oslo.serialization which is depricated.
Correct way to import this is to use
oslo_serialization module name.

The correct way how to fix this would be
installing oslo_log module instead of using
log module from oslo-incubator. But this way
is going to take long time because there are
no corresponding rpm and deb packages available.

TODO: use oslo_log instead of log module from oslo-incubator
when rpm and deb packages are available

Change-Id: I866fa0e19c5b872a82af6739d3537c24916bccc1
Closes-Bug: #1472018
'}]
commit_message:
FA: oslo.serialization -> oslo_serialization

The issue is that oslo log module tries to
import oslo.serialization which is depricated.
Correct way to import this is to use
oslo_serialization module name.

The correct way how to fix this would be
installing oslo_log module instead of using
log module from oslo-incubator. But this way
is going to take long time because there are
no corresponding rpm and deb packages available.

TODO: use oslo_log instead of log module from oslo-incubator
when rpm and deb packages are available

Change-Id: I866fa0e19c5b872a82af6739d3537c24916bccc1
Closes-Bug: #1472018

commit_message:
Remove hotref links in the documentation

Now that we moved the template_guide in-tree, the hotref sphinx
directive doesn't work anymore and isn't needed. This replaces it with
ref directives and a missing-reference handler managing resources.

Change-Id: I5cba4b96894878a57d577c74dd6ade7fd252b164

subject: Optimize Rally imports to reduce start time
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4428, 'name': 'Liyingjun', 'email': 'yinjalee@163.com', 'username': 'liyingjun'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6835, 'name': 'Kun Huang', 'email': 'gareth@openstacker.org', 'username': 'academicgareth'}, {'_account_id': 8576, 'name': 'Yair Fried', 'email': 'yfried@redhat.com', 'username': 'yfried'}, {'_account_id': 9545, 'name': 'Andriy Kurilin', 'email': 'andr.kurilin@gmail.com', 'username': 'akurilin'}, {'_account_id': 12395, 'name': 'Roman Vasylets', 'email': 'pomeo92@gmail.com', 'username': 'rvasilets'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-07-07 04:55:52.000000000', 'files': ['rally/ui/utils.py', 'rally/deployment/engine.py', 'rally/plugins/__init__.py', 'tests/unit/test.py', 'rally/cli/cliutils.py', 'rally/deployment/__init__.py', 'rally/verification/tempest/compare2html.py', 'rally/cli/commands/task.py', 'rally/cli/commands/info.py', 'rally/db/api.py', 'tests/unit/ui/test_utils.py', 'rally/cli/commands/deployment.py'], 'message': 'Optimize Rally imports to reduce start time

* Load plugins only if they are required
  This reduce a lot starting time of Rally and will
  allows us to do online bash completition

  As well it cleans up project structure a lot, e.g.
  all plugins are loaded in single place +
  we don't have strange code in cliutils

* Replace rally.ui.utils to not import mako
  and remove all code on module level

* Make Rally DB lazy inited

* Import plugins during test run

----

The best way to test changes in start up time is to
compare "time rally version" e.g.:

before this patch:
$ time rally version
0.0.5
real	0m0.397s
user	0m0.299s
sys	0m0.089s

after this patch:
0.0.5

real	0m0.281s
user	0m0.200s
sys	0m0.077s

Change-Id: Ibec2e6da66a1304730e801de307df7a1da68d51f
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize Rally imports to reduce start time

* Load plugins only if they are required
  This reduce a lot starting time of Rally and will
  allows us to do online bash completition

  As well it cleans up project structure a lot, e.g.
  all plugins are loaded in single place +
  we don't have strange code in cliutils

* Replace rally.ui.utils to not import mako
  and remove all code on module level

* Make Rally DB lazy inited

* Import plugins during test run

----

The best way to test changes in start up time is to
compare "time rally version" e.g.:

before this patch:
$ time rally version
0.0.5
real	0m0.397s
user	0m0.299s
sys	0m0.089s

after this patch:
0.0.5

real	0m0.281s
user	0m0.200s
sys	0m0.077s

Change-Id: Ibec2e6da66a1304730e801de307df7a1da68d51f

commit_message:
Run neutron multinode without dvr

We had been running tempest full only against neutron + DVR in a
multinode env. Add a second job to run without DVR as we don't want DVR
blocking other multinode work and we may be adding additional non DVR
test setups.

Change-Id: Icb52a0389689fcebb61b3cef5e2881a56723cd30

Fuel Agent: oslo_log instead of oslo.log

because it is now available as a separate package.
Besides it has been removed from oslo-incubator.

Closes-Bug: #1472018

commit_message:
Remove unused fields "from_*" from API controller

Remove the fields below:
* magnum.api.controllers.v1.bay.BaysController.from_bays
* magnum.api.controllers.v1.baymodel.BayModelController.from_baymodels
* magnum.api.controllers.v1.container.ContainersController.from_containers
* magnum.api.controllers.v1.node.NodesController.from_nodes
* magnum.api.controllers.v1.pod.PodsController.from_pods
* magnum.api.controllers.v1.service.ServicesController.from_services
* magnum.api.controllers.v1.replicationcontroller.
      ReplicationControllersController.from_rcs

These fields were ported from Ironic at the very beginning of the
project, and they are unused so far. Also remove OperationNotPermitted
exception since it is not used anymore.

Change-Id: Ie655b95dd4325641278fc195fa2032f60087b3fa
Closes-Bug: 1471431

is_hostname_safe was broken in several ways, which are documented in

is_valid_logical_name, which checks that logical names contain only
RFC 3986 unreserved characters, which is what was decided upon in the

commit_message:
Replace is_hostname_safe with a better check

is_hostname_safe was broken in several ways, which are documented in
bug #1468508. This replaces is_hostname_safe with a
is_valid_logical_name, which checks that logical names contain only
RFC 3986 unreserved characters, which is what was decided upon in the
Ironic meeting on 29 June 2015.

A new API microversion, 1.10, is introduced to handle this change.

Additionally, the performance of the old is_hostname_safe() is
improved in several ways.

Closes-Bug: #1468508
Closes-Bug: #1434376
Change-Id: I77441ae5a00e52b84051672ecab5785dd0b033a5

commit_message:
Adjust yaql version in upper-constraints

Pin yaql to 0.2.6. 0.3.0 should be excluded and is already excluded
in global-requirements.txt, but commit b0eddd76 landed after
upper-constraints.txt was introduced.

Current version of yaql (0.3.0) blocks Murano dsvm jobs.

Change-Id: Icc0d2c2c796d21cd93b2211f23dbb75c68e307a6

commit_message:
Generic rpc callback mechanism which could be reused

This is a publisher/subscriber messaging mechanism optimized
for agent consumption and server production without the need
of creating new rpc messages when new resources are introduced.

Oslo versionedobjects are the perfect match to ensure
cross version compatibility even if the published/subscribed
resources format change over time.

This is still a basic stub allowing get_info of the resources,
and the next change will introduce the RPC methods to call
get_info: I0ac8a009e781b6edb283d8634b1a2f047db092dc

The plugin is returning stub objects to be consumed from the
agent to test the basic behaviour until we have DB.

TODO: Update documentation, according to code changes,
      enforce versioned objects only doing deserial/serialization.

Co-Authored-By: Miguel Angel Ajo <mangelajo@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Eran Gampel <eran@gampel.net>

Change-Id: I524cf5a14e99dc6bee4d4261557d98c75efa0809

commit_message:
Refactoring of environment.py

- Removed unnecessary iterations with all(map(...))
- Better use of Django QuerySets
- Promote function reuse
- Get rid of some nested if's
- Remove unnecessary dict.get's

Change-Id: I74725d5ea4afd0f0f86dbb93f8846dbe0edc8f86

commit_message:
Fix wrong check when create image without data.

The default value of 'locations' is [].So there is a wrong check in
db/sqlalchemy/api.py.
When create an image without data, The function '_image_locations_set'
should not be executed.

Change-Id: Ie4cb29ab0d714d3ce67f717d5eaf641424efa5b7
Closes-bug:#1471080

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-08-19 22:07:10.000000000', 'files': ['glance/domain/__init__.py'], 'message': "Allow setting virtual-size during image create

Change Ie4f58ee2e4da3a6c1229840295c7f62023a95b70 added support for a new image
attribute, virtual_size, for API v2. However, there isn't a way for the user
to set this value, as it is read-only. In the future, glance should set this
virtual_size via introspection. Since that is not possible at the moment,
let the user set it when they create the instance.

Change-Id: Ifb550ba250feddd77555d500bdceb4dd8b8db43e
"}]
commit_message:
Allow setting virtual-size during image create

Change Ie4f58ee2e4da3a6c1229840295c7f62023a95b70 added support for a new image
attribute, virtual_size, for API v2. However, there isn't a way for the user
to set this value, as it is read-only. In the future, glance should set this
virtual_size via introspection. Since that is not possible at the moment,
let the user set it when they create the instance.

Change-Id: Ifb550ba250feddd77555d500bdceb4dd8b8db43e

subject: Revert "Enable version discovery"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 17:57:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/tests/unit/v1/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/fixture_data/base.py', 'cinderclient/client.py', 'cinderclient/shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/test_client.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Enable version discovery"

This reverts commit ae03d2a721bd9acb61805ce792a27fb7cf88e5cd.

Cases where a deployment is using a proxy, Cinder servers won't return
the expected publicURL, and instead gives an internal URL that the
client can't use.

Commit 2eb25ab8803214cb3beb5d8fe3efbf70a462c414 in Cinder introduces the
public_endpoint config option, but not everyone is expected to be
running that later of a version to take advantage of this.

Closes-Bug: #1464160
Change-Id: I61228c1e8630b958c792be077674b48fbdb83135
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Enable version discovery"

This reverts commit ae03d2a721bd9acb61805ce792a27fb7cf88e5cd.

Cases where a deployment is using a proxy, Cinder servers won't return
the expected publicURL, and instead gives an internal URL that the
client can't use.

Commit 2eb25ab8803214cb3beb5d8fe3efbf70a462c414 in Cinder introduces the
public_endpoint config option, but not everyone is expected to be
running that later of a version to take advantage of this.

Closes-Bug: #1464160
Change-Id: I61228c1e8630b958c792be077674b48fbdb83135

Add 55572 to the reserved ports list for murano

this change, some deployments fail occastionally when port 55572 is in
use.

commit_message:
Move devstack-external-plugins spec into implemented

This commit moves the devstack-external-plugins spec into the
implemented dir. This bp was closed some time ago but the spec
approval fell through the cracks and was only merged recently.
Additionally the recent patch to do a mass cleanup of all the
specs missed this move to implemented. So let's take care of
it now.

As part of this the devstack specs line in the index is commented
out because this was the last open devstack spec. Without any open
specs in the devstack dir sphinx will warn on there being no files,
which we treat as a fatal error in ci.

Change-Id: Icf4d96ac46c5abdec5f7036d10d5e249d8471a73

subject: Stop checking the status of node if nova boot fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-07 03:11:55.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/exercise.sh'], 'message': 'Stop checking the status of node if nova boot fails

devstack/exercise.sh tries to check the status of node at the most 30 times
otherwise "nova boot" fails.
If the status of node is ERROR, trying to check the status makes no sence
anymore.

This patch set fix this. If "nova boot" fails, devstack/exercise.sh doesn't
try to check the status of node anymore.

Change-Id: Ia4d279acad977833c16c57d7bc9677275de38504
'}]
commit_message:
Stop checking the status of node if nova boot fails

devstack/exercise.sh tries to check the status of node at the most 30 times
otherwise "nova boot" fails.
If the status of node is ERROR, trying to check the status makes no sence
anymore.

This patch set fix this. If "nova boot" fails, devstack/exercise.sh doesn't
try to check the status of node anymore.

Change-Id: Ia4d279acad977833c16c57d7bc9677275de38504

commit_message:
Allow to do not use CPU 'host-model'

In some cases 'host-model' mode for CPU settings may cause kernel panics.
To fix this issue new setting DRIVER_USE_HOST_CPU was added.
If enabled (by default) 'host-model' is used, if disabled default mode
(which is "custom") is used.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1464551

Change-Id: Id275d1b0371981c02d9727539caa46e531e73557

subject: Keep the path when re-registering the template resource
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-06 23:54:34.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_environment.py', 'heat/engine/environment.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py'], 'message': 'Keep the path when re-registering the template resource

Since Ib0c191db2dccac6d467a9961062424bc1f924c24 we re-register a
template resource in case the global environment is changed. This
is fine but the path to the resource is not maintained. This patch
fixes that by passing the path through to the registration function.

Change-Id: I7a8ec66d0f12a12bb4e44d2eb7efd182d758fea1
'}]
commit_message:
Keep the path when re-registering the template resource

Since Ib0c191db2dccac6d467a9961062424bc1f924c24 we re-register a
template resource in case the global environment is changed. This
is fine but the path to the resource is not maintained. This patch
fixes that by passing the path through to the registration function.

Change-Id: I7a8ec66d0f12a12bb4e44d2eb7efd182d758fea1

commit_message:
Update wsgi.py to support reload from conf on SIGHUP

These changes are taken from the glance wsgi.py from where
heat wsgi.py originated. These changes are to support reload
of the service with new configuration parameters when SIGHUP
is received.

The reload of conf will only work if the server is running
with workers. If workers is 0 then it wont reload.

Co-Authored-By: Tetiana Lashchova <tlashchova@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I7fd391209591c149fb95136d92dd1d82cfb7a6de
Closes-Bug: #1449807
Closes-Bug: #1276694

commit_message:
Increase ovsdb timeout.

I've seen several timeouts in the logs for the CI jobs that are
running tempest.  The tests put the VM under heavy load so give things
more time to complete by default before considering it a failure.

Change-Id: Ibc2c64591b2ef26ae481c01b8b4744fb23b4f164
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for port admin_state_up

Neutron supports administratively setting the state of a port to up or
down.  Support for this was just merged for OVN and this patch
integrates that support with Neutron.

Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1467971

subject: This documents the use of comments that work between 2.6, 2.7 and 3.4
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-22 03:38:19.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst'], 'message': 'This documents the use of comments that work between 2.6, 2.7 and 3.4

Comments are not directly handled by PBR, this documents a reasonable working
set of comments that can be used in setup.cfg.

Comments are parsed out over three locations, configparser, which varies rather
significantly between two and three, pkg_resources, and lastly when pip runs.

Change-Id: Iedebc5baca4e21081708971540d6eab89e043f05
'}]
commit_message:
This documents the use of comments that work between 2.6, 2.7 and 3.4

Comments are not directly handled by PBR, this documents a reasonable working
set of comments that can be used in setup.cfg.

Comments are parsed out over three locations, configparser, which varies rather
significantly between two and three, pkg_resources, and lastly when pip runs.

Change-Id: Iedebc5baca4e21081708971540d6eab89e043f05

subject: rbd: clean up unused parents of clones on deletion
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1107, 'name': 'Josh Durgin', 'email': 'jdurgin@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdurgin'}, {'_account_id': 1313, 'name': 'yaguang', 'email': 'heut2008@gmail.com', 'username': 'heut2008'}, {'_account_id': 4912, 'name': 'Michael H Wilson', 'email': 'geekinutah@gmail.com', 'username': 'geekinutah'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6984, 'name': 'Sébastien Han', 'email': 'seb@redhat.com', 'username': 'leseb'}, {'_account_id': 9236, 'name': 'Jon Bernard', 'email': 'jobernar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jbernard'}, {'_account_id': 16412, 'name': 'Vikhyat Umrao', 'email': 'vumrao@redhat.com', 'username': 'vikhyat'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-21 13:34:51.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_rbd_store.py'], 'message': "rbd: clean up unused parents of clones on deletion

In order to make snapshotting ephemeral disks stored in rbd efficient
and avoid any local disk use, nova will tell glance about an rbd
snapshot's location rather than uploading data.

Since rbd images with snapshots cannot be deleted, nova cannot remove
the original disk in this case. Instead, nova renames the original rbd
image so glance can determine that it is no longer used by
nova. Glance can then delete this rbd image once its snapshots are
deleted.

To effect this, modify the rbd store's backend to recursively delete
any parents that have a special string in their name. This has no
chance of name collision from other openstack use since rbd images are
otherwise only named with uuids.

If an image based on a vm is deleted while the vm is still running,
only delete the parent snapshot, not the whole vm image. Rename
_delete_image() to _cleanup_image(), and add _cleanup_parent() to
determine when deleting the parent is safe.

To allow glance to handle this, it needs write access to the ceph pool
used by nova ephemeral disks.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #1346525
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

Change-Id: Ie49cf7f22c4b6c33b27316118e5cfaaad88cce9a
"}]
commit_message:
rbd: clean up unused parents of clones on deletion

In order to make snapshotting ephemeral disks stored in rbd efficient
and avoid any local disk use, nova will tell glance about an rbd
snapshot's location rather than uploading data.

Since rbd images with snapshots cannot be deleted, nova cannot remove
the original disk in this case. Instead, nova renames the original rbd
image so glance can determine that it is no longer used by
nova. Glance can then delete this rbd image once its snapshots are
deleted.

To effect this, modify the rbd store's backend to recursively delete
any parents that have a special string in their name. This has no
chance of name collision from other openstack use since rbd images are
otherwise only named with uuids.

If an image based on a vm is deleted while the vm is still running,
only delete the parent snapshot, not the whole vm image. Rename
_delete_image() to _cleanup_image(), and add _cleanup_parent() to
determine when deleting the parent is safe.

To allow glance to handle this, it needs write access to the ceph pool
used by nova ephemeral disks.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #1346525
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

Change-Id: Ie49cf7f22c4b6c33b27316118e5cfaaad88cce9a

commit_message:
Add 55572 to the reserved ports list for murano

This change adds 55572 to the reserved ports list for murano. Without
this change, some deployments fail occastionally when port 55572 is in
use.

Change-Id: If62504a5b3b7110d35278fe3654cdbb35dbbe194
Closes-Bug: 1467024

subject: Return one workflow when PUT/POST one definition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-27 02:31:34.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_workflows.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/workflow.py'], 'message': 'Return one workflow when PUT/POST one definition

Based on usage feedback: when POST or PUT a single workflow definition,
it is unexpected and confusing to receive an array of single workflows. 

Fix: return a single workflow when post a single definition, 
and keep the current behavior when posting multiple definitions.

Change-Id: Ibbc5ab1eb255af53d5e22715187ec62136769eda'}]
commit_message:
Return one workflow when PUT/POST one definition

Based on usage feedback: when POST or PUT a single workflow definition,
it is unexpected and confusing to receive an array of single workflows. 

Fix: return a single workflow when post a single definition, 
and keep the current behavior when posting multiple definitions.

Change-Id: Ibbc5ab1eb255af53d5e22715187ec62136769eda

commit_message:
Add max_header_size field for PKI tokens

PKI tokens can be extremely large (>64k), requiring
a custom max_header_size to be configured.
This field defaults to the default from swift internal
defaults, which is 8192 bytes.

Change-Id: I9d2df074e333e110df4dfeaf5ba1cdab5c4ff19f
Related-Bug: #1470664

commit_message:
Allow deleting even associated and active node in maintenance mode

This nasty change is required to give operators the final means
to get rid of completely broken node. Examples are nodes with BMC
failed during deploy, or nodes enrolled with a wrong (or buggy)
driver. Downstream issue:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1229401

Change-Id: Id357a5be9b7eb2b72d30e5028eeee40d465d1c92
Partial-Bug: #1465153

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-23 06:48:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': "support manually moving dvr-snat router

current neutron commands like l3-agent-router-add and
l3-agent-router-remove couldn't totally support add/remove
a dvr-snat router to/from a dvr_snat l3-agent, these two
commands will deal with router part, but not snat part.
By that it will be unable to manually move dvr-snat router.
This patch will try to fix this.

Change-Id: I3249a586524cbb0edb4611d96c087733445825e2
Closes-Bug: #1369721

commit_message:
support manually moving dvr-snat router

current neutron commands like l3-agent-router-add and
l3-agent-router-remove couldn't totally support add/remove
a dvr-snat router to/from a dvr_snat l3-agent, these two
commands will deal with router part, but not snat part.
By that it will be unable to manually move dvr-snat router.
This patch will try to fix this.

Change-Id: I3249a586524cbb0edb4611d96c087733445825e2
Closes-Bug: #1369721

subject: Fix module install in beaker
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-07 00:32:58.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'message': "Fix module install in beaker

Since the postgresql module is already installed on nodepool nodes,
r10k it isn't properly purging it before installing our modules to test
with. Let's not trust r10k to do this, let's do it ourselves.

Change-Id: If54a2caeaa58b419610fc558271c436ddce91cfb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix module install in beaker

Since the postgresql module is already installed on nodepool nodes,
r10k it isn't properly purging it before installing our modules to test
with. Let's not trust r10k to do this, let's do it ourselves.

Change-Id: If54a2caeaa58b419610fc558271c436ddce91cfb

commit_message:
Add openstack bot to #openstack-diversity channel

The OpenStack Diversity Working Group has started a new IRC
channel and would like to enable openstack bot services on
it. This patch adds the #openstack-diversity channel to the
puppe manifests that manage the irc bot.

Change-Id: Ic8623f9e8ba2bc70077cd417c90fb0ca09fca666

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-07-06 03:28:00.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/autoscaling/test_heat_scaling_group.py', 'heat/engine/resources/aws/autoscaling/autoscaling_group.py', 'heat/tests/autoscaling/test_scaling_policy.py', 'heat/scaling/cooldown.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/scaling_policy.py', 'heat/tests/autoscaling/test_heat_scaling_policy.py', 'heat/tests/autoscaling/test_scaling_group.py'], 'message': 'ASG scaling account for cooldown timestamp & in-progress

There are cases where it takes a long time to create a new resource as
requested by the scaling operation on an ASG resource, for instance, a
nova server creation followed by a complex SoftwareDeployment. During
this process, additional alarms may come in but failed to be blocked
by the current cooldown checking mechanism because the very first
timestamp has yet to be generated. This is leading to unexpected size
adjustment to the ASG.

This patch augments the existing cooldown checking mechanism with a
scaling-in-progress test so that additional alarms arriving during
the very first scaling operation will be ignored.

Change-Id: Ib8aa83eed366df7097c9cbb9247eca866ae4b620
Closes-Bug: #1375156
'}]
commit_message:
ASG scaling account for cooldown timestamp & in-progress

There are cases where it takes a long time to create a new resource as
requested by the scaling operation on an ASG resource, for instance, a
nova server creation followed by a complex SoftwareDeployment. During
this process, additional alarms may come in but failed to be blocked
by the current cooldown checking mechanism because the very first
timestamp has yet to be generated. This is leading to unexpected size
adjustment to the ASG.

This patch augments the existing cooldown checking mechanism with a
scaling-in-progress test so that additional alarms arriving during
the very first scaling operation will be ignored.

Change-Id: Ib8aa83eed366df7097c9cbb9247eca866ae4b620
Closes-Bug: #1375156

commit_message:
Clean up Ceph entry points

This moves all of the Ceph task entrypoints to a common location. Previously,
they where in three separate locations which leads to difficulty when
attempting to maintain the module.

Change-Id: Ia84e16e38da65cacd4096fbcf24d405f886e6437
Related-bug: #1467700

commit_message:
Use symbol for error code in VNX cinder driver

Some of the error code of VNX CLI is scattered in the code and is
not coded as a constant.

Gather all VNX error codes in the VNXError class and compose a new
method to check the error in the CLI output.  If no specific error
is supplied, check all available errors in the output.

Change-Id: I145803fbe9fc36dcf432c9aa4d90245790a69859
Closes-Bug: #1454905
